loans.use: to buy ten 90-kgs sacks of maize.

loans.name: Mansir

texts.en:
Mansir is is 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and mother in Marneuli district. 

His mother works as a teacher at a local school and gets 350 Gel per month. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where greens are grown to sell locally. 

Mansir decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3,000 to start a plastic workshop. Mansir is experienced in this field and hopes that the business will be profitable. He will get orders and produce plastic doors and windows. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to open a  plastic workshop.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 27-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a retailer who sells garments in the main market. Farah owns a small business of selling ladies ready-made garments at home. She also purchases fabrics from the market at a low price, sews garments and then sells them at a higher price in her community. 

The ladies of the town like the selection in her garments collection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warm clothes. Her husband pays all their expenses from his earnings, and Farah contributes her earnings only to savings. 

She requested a loan so that she can buy a variety of garments to fulfill the demand. She wants a bright future for her children, and her dream is to provide a better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for sewing ladies garments to sell.

loans.name: Nyabo Group

texts.en:
The Nyabo group pictured is a group of two Nuru International farmers in Kuria West District. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm supplies. As a group, the members of Nyabo collectively guarantee the loan.

Francis is the leader of the group. He is 45 years old and has been farming for about 10 years. He has benefited from the group since 2012. He is married and has six children. The loan from KIVA will enable him to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which should increase his production of maize, sorghum and millet. 

He hopes to obtain enough food for his family and sell the surplus, and then to invest the money from the sales in a business which will later generate profits that will be used to pay school fees for his six children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Hamdi Abdilahi

texts.en: Hamdi Abdilahi is 26 years old. He studies at Gollis University, with the faculty of Civil Engineering, and he is also a primary school teacher.  He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and to read lessons when given in soft copy. Buying a laptop on his own is the greatest challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide him, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Mzingira Hanata Group

texts.en:
Mzingira Hanata is a Nuru International group of five farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge about how to improve farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Mzingira Hanata collectively guarantee the loan.

Joseph (shown in photo with his hand raised) is a representative of the group and has been a member of the group since 2011. He is a 34-year-old married man with three children who attend school.

The loan from KIVA will enable him to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will result in high yields.  Joseph, like other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in a ¼ acre each. He plans to sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Kiburanga Group

texts.en:
This group of three men is part of the Nuru International group of farmers called Kiburanga and is based within the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising his hand is Patrick. He is 42 years old and married with five children. It is the second year for Patrick as a member of this group.

Patrick desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long rainy seasons.  He is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase these farm inputs. 

Patrick believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields.  He will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to contribute to his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband in Ba Phnum district, Prey Veng province, while her two children are employed and accommodated in Phnom Penh.

In order to improve her family’s economic situation, Sat works in the agricultural sector, growing rice on her own farmland. Her product is harvested and sold to local traders and markets. She has been in this occupation for more than 20 years and earns an income of 4.33 USD per day.

As this is her first loan, Sat aims to invest in the purchase of a solar system to install on the rooftop of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Sat will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she will use to support household appliances such as light, TV and radio so everyone in her family can work or study even at night. She is very happy and thankful because, with this loan, HKL has provided a special interest rate different from its general loan products. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a solar system to install on the rooftop of her house

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid, who is in her early 40s, is married with six children who are in school.  For five years now, Mwanaid has been engaged in a fruits and vegetables business. She opens her grocery huts from 5 am to 6 pm daily and is able to generate a good monthly profit. 

This is her 12th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to replenish her grocery huts with vegetables and fruits. Mwanaid is still seeking a loan to buy stock of fruits and vegetables to attract more customers to her business. She managed to cover all her previous loans successfully.  Mwanaid used her profits to buy a plot of land, bought a TV, radio, bed, mattress, cupboard and paid her children's school fees.  Mwanaid also covered her household expenses. She dreams to build a house. 

Mwanaid will share this loan with her loan group "Protea" which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Kobelo, who is in his late 30s, is married and has got two children who are in school. 

He has been running a general store for seven years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Kobelo's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to expand his general store. It used to be very small but now it is almost like a mini-supermarket. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  

He used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a TV set, a radio and a sewing mashing machine, to cover household expenses and to build a small house. He is really happy with the loan and thanks everyone who has supported his group, which is making a lot of progress. 

He will use this loan to buy a business motorbike.  He dreams of increasing the stock of the general store and wants to own a car.  

Kobelo will share this loan with his loan group "Machimbo," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business motorbike.

loans.name: Nicolas Tolentino

texts.es:
Nicolas es un hombre muy trabajador, cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante, desde hace 3 años, humilde trabajo e ssu única fuente de ingresos y por ello se esfuerza cada día para hacerlo mejor posible.

Nicolas está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá solventar los gastos para la renovación de su licencia de conducir, con este valioso apoyo Nicolas podrá tener sus documentos en regla y evitar infracciones, pero sobre todo poder trabajar tranquilo y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un automóvil propio para trabajar”.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a very hardworking man who strives to get ahead.  For the past three years he has had his humble job which is his only source of income, so he works hard every day to make the best possible.  

Nicolas is grateful to the Kiva lenders who, thanks to their support, have allowed him to pay to renew his drivers’ license.  Now Nicolas can have his documents in order and can avoid infractions, but above all he will be able to work calmly toward achieving his dream, “Having his own car to work with.”

loans.use: to renew his license.

loans.name: Rumana

texts.en:
Rumana is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their financial support. Her previous loan was a big help to her family expenses.

Beside the motorcycle business, Rumana owns rental houses. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to renovate her rental houses. She looks forward to financial support with gladness in her heart.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 36-year-old widowed woman. She has three children. She describes herself as an ambitious person. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy cosmetics and other beauty products for use in the beauty salon. 

Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living and pay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man.  He has a child who is 2 years old.  He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle to earn a living. He has been involved in this business for 4 years.  His business is located in a busy area with lots of customers and he his hired by all types of customer.  

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to purchase a new motorcycle.  He will use the Kes 110,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle for use in his transport business.  His business goal is to be successful within 5 years.  

He hopes that in the future, he will excel in his business.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en: Mishi is a hardworking woman who strives hard to better the living standard of her family. The previous loan helped her to buy cooking oil and wheat flour for her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil for the preparation of dumplings for sale.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil for the preparation of dumplings for sale.

loans.name: Chonje

texts.en:
Chonje lives in the coastal region of Kenya.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah appreciates the previous loan that helped her purchase rabbits which she sold and got income. Here again she comes to you requesting for a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy feed for the rabbits and drugs to ensure productivity.

loans.use: to buy feed for the rabbits and drugs to ensure productivity.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Nanyuki in central province Kenya. She is 38 years and she is a farmer. She is also a wife and a mother of two. She has been in farming for more than ten years now. 

Stella learned of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy farm chemicals and fertilizer. She hopes that in the next five years she can buy a plot of land where she can build rental houses. The challenges that she faces in business include weather and costs of farm inputs like pesticides. The income that she will generate will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2, Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 years and 23 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Aminata established her clothes business. She began her business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support the home .She works at the business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more women's and men's clothing for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school expenses and increase her business. In future she plan to expand her business more than ever.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and men's clothing for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in the Nanyuki area in the central province of Kenya. He is 31 years old and he is a father of one. He is also a businessman and he runs a cereals business in Nanyuki that has been in operation for the last year. The business has grown and he has been able to employ two people to help him run the business. He also owns a spare parts shop that gives him extra income. 

Michael's vision is to have purchased a maize milling machine in the next five years. He learned about Milango through a friend and now he seeks a loan to buy maize, beans and wheat for sale in the cereals business. The major challenge to the business is the low supply of cereals in the market. The income that he will earn will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and wheat for resale

loans.name: Augustino

texts.en: Augustino is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives in a rental house that has no electricity but has piped water. He has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. With the loan he is requesting in the amount of ksh.50,000, he wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Mabinty from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has one child, age 15 years, who is currently attending school. 

In 2004, Mabinty established her clothes business. She began her business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support the home. She works at the business eight hours per day, seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton and plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In future, she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton and plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn is 57 and the mother of five kids. She is a resident of Kampong Thom province where she grows her paddy rice and other crops. Her five-year involvement in her current business has enabled her to earn for almost 9 USD per day.

Yoeurn is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is seeking an education loan to continue her daughter’s education for a university degree majoring in Business Management by covering the school fees. She hopes that she can provide financial support for her kids on time.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's school fees

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Pang, 57, lives with her husband and five children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 39 years. She is able to earn about US $13 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Pang just joined VisionFund and is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s tuition at university, faculty of nurse. She hopes this loan will enable her son to study until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition at university.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nawaizan Bibi Group

texts.en:
Nawaizan Bibi, a 60-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons, and 2 daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Nawaizan Bibi is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Nawaizan Bibi is a member of a 2-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to pay for buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, 49, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Prey Chor district. To make a living, she has been farming for 29 years, and the current business earns her family about 29,000KHR per day. 

Yan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make their living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven members who are hardworking merchants.  One of them is Janet.  She is 54 years old, married, and has a child who is dependent upon her.  Her business involves selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done for 5 years.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweet oranges, carrots, tomatoes, onions and cabbage and sell to customers.

Mary is a 40-year-old woman who sells eggs and milk.  Comfort is 56 years old and sells provisions.  Grace is 50 years old and sells cooking items.  Eunice is 32 years old and sells materials.  Matilda is 40 years and operates a cold store.  Jemima is 33 years and sells spices.

loans.use: To buy sweet oranges, carrots, tomatoes, onions and cabbage and sell to customers.

loans.name: Lis

texts.en:
Lis is a 49-year-old mother of four children who lives in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been  farming rice on two hectares of farmland for almost ten years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Lis has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she is going to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to make more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Amy1 Group

texts.en:
Nobelinda is the featured borrower of the Amy1 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al.  They have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers in Lebanon to provide their families with a good standard of living.

Nobelinda is 47 years old and married, the mother of two children.  She works as a housekeeper to financially support her family back in the Philippines.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's university tuition fees.  It is very important for her to do her best and educate her children to provide them with a brighter future and wider knowledge.

Nobelinda hopes to keep on supporting her family, and she's looking forward to the time she unites back with her family.

She is the first lady standing at the left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Maureen is at the right side with a red top, and  Mirasol is at the center of the picture with a yellow top.

loans.use: To pay her child's university tuition fees

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat is hardworking and kind woman. She is married and has four children. Nazokat lives with her family in a village. She and her husband are teachers. They work in a local school. Nazokat and her husband teach children and they like their jobs. 

Nazokat’s family lives poor as their salary is small. She has not money to buy winter clothes for her children and also to buy food products for winter season. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy winter clothes for her children and food products. This is her first loan from IMON. She had some loans from other banks and had a good credit story. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for her children and food products for winter season.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is a kind woman from the northern part of Tajikistan. She was born in 1962. She has been busy with animal husbandry for many years. She buys cattle, fattens them and then sells them in a local market with a higher price than what she paid for them. She fattens cattle in her house. Her daughter helps her with managing the business. She is the main feed keeper in her family. Her husband is a rental worker. 

Sadaf began to build a new house some years ago because she had a small, old house, but she did not have enough money to finish the building. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as wood, bricks and cement. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as wood, brick and cement for building a new house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a divorced man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. 

He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. He is requesting a loan of  30,000 KES to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 


For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuff of maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.


With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 27, living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a medical clinic in which he provides first aid services to patients. He has been taking training from professional doctors, and now he owns his own small clinic on the basis of his experience. As he treats his patients, the patients become more healthy. He has become very famous in the society and wants to establish his clinic through buying vaccines, injections, medicine, drips, etc.

Abida requested a loan for her husband. She hopes that her husband will be able to buy medicine, vaccines, and injections so that he can earn maximum profit.

loans.use: To buy vaccines, injections, medicine, drips, glucose, etc for the medical clinic.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old, married, and has five children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a buy and sell charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Evelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks or firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Felecidad

texts.en:
Felecidad is 59 years old and married. She has six children. Felecidad works very hard to provide for them.

Felecidad runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 35 years and sells a variety of items.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store like laundry soap, toothpaste, canned goods, bath soap, sugar, vinegar, etc.

 In the future, Felecidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like laundry soap, toothpaste, canned goods, bath soap, sugar, vinegar.

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en: Genesa works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computer. Genesa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computer.

loans.name: Ahmed Yusuf

texts.en:
Ahmed Yusuf is 26 years old. He studies at the University, in the faculty of Education. 

He needs a laptop to prepare assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. 

He cannot pay the money all at one time. He has requested from Kaaba MFI a laptop as a loan, and then Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy  a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Project Group

texts.en:
This group of two farmers is called Project and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand in the picture is Peter. He is 51 years old, married, and has eight children who go to school. Peter has been a member of this group for two years now and has benefited from being educated on various ways to improve farming methods. He is very excited about the 2014 Long Rains season.

Peter has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 Long Rains seasons.  He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. Peter believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to contribute to his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Neri

texts.es: María de 51 años, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como: blusas, faldas, vestidos, etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio y de esta forma se ha ganado la vida ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada y emprendedora, posee mucha clientela por la calidad con que elabora sus prendas de vestir y por los buenos precios, es por esta razón que ha decidido invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, etc. para seguir ofreciendo productos bonitos y de excelente calidad, y decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sus materiales para satisfacer la demanda de prendas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  She makes clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, etc. and has been doing this and earning a living this way for many years.  It’s her main source of income and she is a hardworking, dedicated, and enterprising woman with many customers because of the quality of her work and good prices.  She wants to buy fabric, thread, needles, etc. so she can continue to offer nice products of excellent quality and is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy her supplies to satisfy her customer demand and obtain better earnings so she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old woman. She has one child who is 13 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells cosmetics and other beauty products, and she has been involved in this business for five years.

Elizabeth’s business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are mostly ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy stock of cosmetics. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add stock of cosmetics and other beauty products.

Elizabeth’s business goal is to have a large retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Adama from Waterloo2, Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. 

In 2010, Adama established her local food business. She began her business because she wanted to contribute in taking care of her children. She works at the business 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava and sweet potatoes for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ae

texts.en:
Ae, 61, is from a rural village located in the Borseth district of Kampong Speu province. She is married and has seven children. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, and they have been in this business for 43 years. The current business earns her about US $12 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Ae has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Jeneba from Waterloo2, Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 14 years. Her children are attending school.

Jeneba runs a retail business, selling palm oil, bananas, and charcoal. She has been running this business for six years. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. Jeneba says that her major hardship is the poor road network within her operation area.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to purchase local food such as palm oil, bananas and charcoal for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and improve her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than even. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase local food such as palm oil, bananas and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Marie from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children. One of her children is currently attending school.  In 2008, Marie established her clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support the home.  She works at the business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that her major problem to her business is the improper business location.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase wax cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay for her children's school and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever.

loans.use: to purchase wax cotton for resale

loans.name: Samphan's Group

texts.en: Samphan, a young mother of two dependent kids, is a 27-year-old farmer who grows rice as the main source of income. To supplement the family income, her husband also catches fish to resale. Currently, she is able to earn up to 13,900 KHR per day from the business that she has had for several years.  Samphan, a fourth-time borrower, and her co-borrower, who is a first-time borrower, are in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has enabled her to improve her living conditions better than before. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to buy fishing materials to catch more fish. She hopes to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and to buy fishing materials to catch more fish.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en: Mao is a widowed mother blessed with one kid.  She is currently living in the Kampong Cham province where she grows crops as the main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for ten years and it has returned to her about 33,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has successfully repaid, has helped her to earn a decent income and to build a proper latrine for her family.  For this cycle, she has teamed up with a group of three to get a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for a reaping fee and also spend a small portion to buy a household appliance for her family.

loans.use: To pay for a reaping fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a member of this group and lives in Dannsoman. She is 38 years old and married. Together she and her spouse have two children, and both are in school. 

Mary has been in the business of selling rice, assorted soap, assorted toffee and cooking oil for eight years. She is on her eighth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. 

With this loan, she will increase her business capital and purchase more rice, assorted soap, assorted toffee and cooking oil to resell, in order to increase her profits. Together with two others, they will need a total amount of GHS 3,200 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, assorted soap, assorted toffee and cooking oil to resell, in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.ru: Elgun is a taxi driver. He is married. His wife is a pregnant and in this year his child will be born. Elgun’s family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Mahmudlu village of Fuzuli region where near war zone. Previously he took a loan from Kiva organization for repair his taxi. Unfortunately a while ago his car crashed and it was useless. Then Elgun’s father helps to buy another car, but that car is old. Today Elgun wants to repair his car and increase the business. Therefore he needs 1000 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). He is so hardworking man and he hope that after repair he will be work hard and his business will be better. Elgun thankful to Komak company, Kiva organizations and lenders for the loan. He wants to give a good education to his child in the future.
texts.en: Elgun is a taxi driver. He is married, and he and his wife are expecting a child this year. Elgun and his family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the city of Fuzuli. They now live in Mahmudlu village in the Fuzuli District, near the war zone. Elgun previously took out a Kiva loan for taxi repairs, but unfortunately his car was wrecked in a crash a while ago. Elgun's father helped him to buy another car, but it is old and needs repairs. Elgun needs 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the car so he can do more business. He is a hardworking man and hopes that business will improve once the repairs are made. Elgun is grateful to Komak, Kiva, and the lenders. In the future he wants to give his child a good education.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
Davron was born in 1981.  He is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife. 

Davron lives with his family in a rural community. He is a builder. Davron sells his services to local people. He builds wonderful houses with modern planning. He has additional income from animal husbandry. 

Davron must increase his working capital and get enough income as his children require more money. Davron is asking for a loan of TJS 4,000 to buy cattle for increasing his working capital. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase his working capital

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Toem is an experienced farmer from the Banteay Chas village of Baray district in Kampong Thom province. She is 53 years old, married, and has four children who live with her under the same roof. Her husband, who is the main breadwinner of the family, is engaged in fishing to support their family and he also helps Toem manage their rice fields. Toem has been a farmer for over 25 years and earns a normal income of KHR 10,000 per day.

Currently Toem doesn’t have a household latrine at home, so she would like to build a safe one to protect the family from illness and promote their health. Due to inadequate capital, she has requested a loan of USD 440 to buy materials needed and pay for labor costs in performing the construction. The  water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has encouraged Toem to focus on ensuring healthful living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine to protect the family from illness and promote their health.

loans.name: Lay Ing

texts.en:
Lay Ing is married and has four children.  She lives in a rural area of the Baray district in Kampong Thom province. She is 34-years-old and an industrious farmer who has managed a three-hectare farmland growing rice and is also involved in selling fish, which is caught by her husband. From her current businesses, she is able to make a daily income of KHR 20,000 per day. 

To help Lay Ing further develop her farming business, she has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to use on her farm. Her dreams are to expand her farming business in order to have more income for her family and save enough for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to use on her farm.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 49-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as a determined person. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She also keeps poultry that produce eggs to sell. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in an area conducive to dairy farming and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds and outbreaks of diseases that affect milk production. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy animal feeds and poultry feeds. Her business goal is to reach a wider market within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will maximize profits and improve her living standards. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Carlest

texts.en: Carlest, a very hardworking and enterprising married man, has been selling goats in the market for the past two years. His main business challenge is unstable market prices. Having joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds, Carlest is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson appreciates that his previous loan improved his living standards.  His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income.
He would like to apply for a loan of KSH 50,000 to buy more stock of goats for his business.  He thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goats for his business

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo2, Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. 

In 2001, Jariatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business 10 hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, drinks, soap and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, drinks, soap and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Shila is a 41-year-old woman of Milapara village in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Gopal, who is 49 years old. They are blessed with two children. Amongst them, one is studying in class VII (grade 7), and the other one is involved in business. 

Shila is a housewife, while her husband is a farmer. Unfortunately, their income is too low for leading a standard life. Her husband farms and sells different kinds of vegetables in the market. 

Now Shila desires to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), and with the loan money she will purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato farming on her own land. With the profit from her business, she hopes to build a concrete house for her family and to be able to provide her children a better lifestyle. She also hopes that her new plan of potato cultivation will improve their financial condition as well as their lifestyle. 

Shila is very much obliged to BJS and Kiva that they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Mukta

texts.en:
Mukta is a 24-year-old housewife from a rural village, Magurmari, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Bablu , aged 35 years, in their own pacca house (concrete-made). Both Mukta and her husband attended school up to higher secondary level.

To take care of the family's needs, Mukta's husband is extensively engaged in agriculture and in the cultivation of onions, beans, chilies, etc. They sell the agricultural products in the local market; this is the main source of income for the family.

In order to continue developing their agribusiness in a sustainable way, Mukta needs to make some investments. She needs a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of potatoes, so she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS.

Mukta hopes to earn additional profits from this new business, as potatoes are in great demand in the present market. She will be able to fulfill her dreams, such as upgrade their poor financial condition, sustain their agribusiness and purchase a tractor in the future, with the profit generated from this business.

They are thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their help to start their new business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Lipika

texts.en:
Lipika, age 23, is from a small village, Magurmari, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and lives with her husband and two children (sons). She is a housewife and read up to grade 10. One of their sons is a student of grade 1; the other is below the school-going age. They have a concrete-made house.

Lipika's husband, Partha, aged 30 years, is engaged in a small business. His income is not sufficient to cover all the expenses of her family. He is the only source of income for their family. Though a housewife, Lipika also helps her husband in his business, yet it is impossible for them to live life in a decent way. That’s why Lipika has decided to start a business of her own. 

She wants to start a bakery shop and wants to prepare breads, biscuits, etc. She needs some capital to start her business. Lipika has taken a loan from BJS to purchase necessary ingredients like flour, yeast, oil, cinnamon, sugar, baking powder and other necessary equipment to start her bakery. As it is a profitable business, she hopes it will give her greater profitability, as there are no other bakery shops in the locality. This will improve her family’s financial condition.   

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients to start a bakery shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 and lives in the Ganta area.  She is unmarried with four children, ages  9-months-old to 13-years-old. Only three live at home and attend school.  For the past six years, she has been involved in the sale of red oil and clothes.  Alice has requested a loan to purchase more red oil and clothes in order to have her business turn into a bigger one. The problem she faces is the changing of USD to Liberian dollars.  She started this business from selling for her mother and learned this from friends.  What she likes about this business is that she makes new friends and meets people each and every day, it makes her proud of having money in her home every day.  In the future, she wants to open another shop near the present shop.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil and clothes

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members. Rebecca is one of them. She is 42-years-old, married and has three children. She has been selling bananas, maize and groundnuts for 20 years.  She has been with the institution for five years and needs this loan to buy more bananas, maize and groundnuts to sell to customers.

Paulina is 40-years-old and she sells bananas, maize and groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, maize and groundnuts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 49, is a married woman. She is running a small shop where she sells cloth and dressmaking supplies. Her husband is a welder by profession and earns insufficient income to bear their household expenditures alone. Safia counts a good client list and is the best-earning resource in her household. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her to purchase spools of thread, along with bundles of cloth in various colors. In this way, Safia would be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, along with bundles of cloth in various colors.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 40-year-old widow and the mother of four children. She has been running a tailoring business for the past nine years. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses. 

After the death of her husband, Sajida is the only source of income for her family. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Sajida contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase a new stitching machine, along with some spools of thread and laces in various colors. 

Sajida is currently in her third loan cycle and she has shown good credit history. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, along with some spools of thread and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been in the business of making artificial jewelry for many years. The business has great potential for growth and and she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family's income.  In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Azra has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ella es elizabeth, estudiante de auxiliar de enfermería de tercer semestre, escogió esta carrera porque cree que es una profesión en la cual puede ayudar a los enfermos y también obtener económicamente un beneficio para seguir con los estudios universitarios, actualmente realizo practicas en un hospital, la experiencia es excelente, el saber que tiene un paciente el tratar con ellos, el dar una sonrisa, el que le devuelvan el mismo trato que ella les da a los pacientes es algo que ella siente muy bonito, aprendió a tener humildad a dar amor a cada paciente.
Los jefes que tiene en el hospital son excelentes, siempre están dispuestos a corregir el error que ella tenga para que no se vuelva a repetir, explican los procedimientos con calma y ella se siente a gusto en la labor que esta desempeñando.
La razón por la cual solicita la ayuda es porque anteriormente tenia otro programa y ya no continua y ella tiene el conocimiento del convenio con kiva, quiere ser parte de el, pues le pago de la mensualidad normal quedo muy alto y la mama no alcanza a cubrir este valor ya que ella gana un salario mínimo, es separada y ella quiere seguir con los estudios. 
Gracias por la atención prestada y el apoyo a campo alto y a ella.
texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, a nurse’s aide student in her third semester.  She chose this major because she believes that it is a profession in which she can help sick people while economically getting enough to continue with her university studies.  Currently she is doing her practical training in a hospital.  The experience is excellent: knowing what a patient has, treating them, giving them a smile and getting one in return.  The care that she gives to the patients is something that makes her feel good.  She has learned to have the humility to give love to each patient.

The managers she has in the hospital are excellent.  They are always ready to correct her mistakes so that she doesn’t repeat them.  They explain the procedures calmly and she feels comfortable in the work that she is carrying out.

The reason that she is asking for help is because previously she had another program, but it is no longer continuing.  She knows about the Kiva program and wants to be part of it because the normal monthly fees are high. Her mom can’t manage to cover the amount because she earns minimum wage and is separated, but Elizabeth wants to continue with her studies.

Thanks for the attention given and the support to her and to Campo Alto.

loans.use: to pay for registration for a semester.

loans.name: Bercella

texts.es:
Bercelia tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Caserío de Puchea en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad progresista, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, proceso que consiste en hervir la caña y luego purificarla para utilizarlo como una bebida para festejar y celebrar ocasiones especiales, también se utiliza con fines curativos y como antiséptico.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de depósitos para el almacenamiento del aguardiente y de esta manera poder trasladar su producto a otras zonas de la provincia de Cutervo, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bercella is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in the village of Puchea in Callayuc district. It is a progressive community whose population engages in farming, trade and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Cutervo, which is located in the Cajamarca region in the mountains of northern Perú.

She makes a living distilling liquor, a process that consist of boiling sugar cane and then purifying it to use as a drink for celebrations and special occasions. It is also used for curative purposes and as an antiseptic.

She has requested a loan of S/. 1,000 to purchase tanks to store the liquor. In this way she will be able to transport her product to other areas of Cutervo province and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tanks to store liquor.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 24 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional  bicycle for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris lives in Kongowea, which is near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 31 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a trained tailor who makes and repairs clothing for a living. He started this business with income he earned from a former employer. He learned of Milango from friends who asked him to join so he could access funding in the future. He has requested this loan to buy a sewing machine for his business. His ambition is to open three tailoring shops in the future and earn enough money to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Itacho Group

texts.en:
This group of five farmers is called Itacho. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Susan, who is raising her hand in the photo, has been a member of this group since the year 2012. She is 40 years old and is married with five children. 

Susan is keen to ensure she gets a good harvest that will sustain her family with food. She has gained a lot of knowledge on better farming methods. However, she is constrained financially in acquiring farm inputs. It is for this reason that Susan is requesting a loan to enable her to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

With the loan, Susan will obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer, and is hopeful that this will enable her to get a bountiful harvest that will provide her entire household with food. She believes she will also sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He is asking for a loan to buy kitchen items such as utensils, cutlery, etc. that will help him to invest back into his business. He is grateful for the financial support he has received.

loans.use: to buy kitchen items such as utensils, cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 34 year old married woman. She has one child who is 13 years old. Anastasia describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk, which she sells. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. 

Anastasia's business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy animal feed for her dairy cows. This will ensure that her cows have enough feed during the dry season.

Her business goal is to expand her milk production and to have a large market to sell her milk within 5 years. Anastasia hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of  KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to repay this loan.

loans.use: buy animal feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 41-year-old married man. He has two children, ages three years and five years. He describes himself as an enterprising person. He operates a retail shop where he sells bread, milk, wheat flour, soap, cakes and other items. 

He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low season which affects sales. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of bread, milk, cakes, soap, flour and other items he sells. His business goal is to open a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his eighth loan with SMEP DTM.  His previous loan of  KES 200,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: add stock of bread, milk, cakes, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 38 year old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes and bags. Her business is located in a marketable area and her primary customers are local residents.

Dorcas describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes and bags. Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes and bags.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
One of this group's two members, Florence is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She has been selling pork meat for 10 years. 

Florence has been with ID Ghana for four years and is requesting this loan to buy more pork meat to sell. Her fellow group member, Kofi, is 41 years old and sells engine oil. He will use his portion of the loan to purchase more oil.

loans.use: To buy more pork meat to sell

loans.name: Greees

texts.en:
Greees is a 43-year-old married woman who has been running a business manufacturing footballs for many years. She has a good client list and contributes a lot to the family income as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. Greees is a motivated mother of three children; she is liable to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. 

To improve her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of PKR 45000.  This amount will be used to purchase spools of thread, rubber bladders and leather material. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales which will ultimately help to generate more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, rubber bladders and leather material.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 52-year-old married woman; she deals in business selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.
.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 26-year-old married woman.  Eight years ago, she started her own business of selling fabrics with the support of her husband. She purchases a variety of fancy fabric from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality material in her community. 

Uzma requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season. By taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store, with the help of her husband, at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 52-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries).  She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and is currently requesting a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 50-years-old, married woman. For many years, she has been running a business of animal sales and purchases. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She also sells milk to her neighbors, to generate an extra amount of income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Rukhsana has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her fifth loan cycle, with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en: Kishwer is a 32-year-old married woman.  She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She deals with more customers time after time.  For this she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.  So she applied for a loan of RS 50,000 through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her 9th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  

Nighat makes enough income to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan for PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy inventory of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands for these items consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 55-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her own business of milk sales. She has been operating her business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Anwar has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her milk sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of manufacturing furniture for a period of about 4 years. At this time, she has become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Azra is a responsible mother of seven children and is responsible to provide them with the basic necessities of life. In order to purchase good quality wood, along with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Azra dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, along with the packs of polish and nails.

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en:
Reshma is a 52-year-old married woman who has running a business with her husband, selling milk, for many years. She has four cows and three buffaloes, which she uses for milk production, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.

Reshma has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Reshma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Galenur

texts.en:
Galenur is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in the village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). She attended school up to grade 5. Both their sons are receiving education and read in grade 9 and grade 8 respectively. Their daughter is married.

Galenur's husband, Habibur, 48 years old, is a sweeper. He works in his locality from door to door and earns very little. Galenur is also very energetic and hardworking. She runs an animal husbandry, after managing her household work. Nevertheless, they live in poverty because their income is not sufficient for their four-member family.

Galenur decided to start a milk supply and dairy products business. She asked for a loan from BJS. The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Galenur will place the cow in the cattle shed located in her yard and start her business of selling milk and milk products (butter, curd, paneer, etc.).  The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and she will be able to give better education and a better future to her sons.

In the future, she wants to purchase more cows to expand her business. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Barnali

texts.en:
Barnali is 45 years old. She attended school up to grade 10. She lives with her children (two sons) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a widow; her husband died a few years back. Her two sons (aged 19 years and 17 years) are engaged in a small business. Their earnings are the main sources of income for the family, but they are not able to provide sufficient financial support to the family. Barnali has decided to start her own business to give her family additional support.

Barnali has decided to start a business of selling betel nuts. Betel nut is a kind of mouth freshener that is used by the local people. Barnali has taken a loan from BJS to buy betel nuts to start her business. She will sell betel nuts to her neighbors.

She is a hardworking and energetic woman. She has lost her husband, but never gave up. She always struggles to give a better life to her family. She hopes to earn a great profit from this business, which will provide her family a favorable, stable economic condition and improve her family's quality of life.

Barnali is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to start a business of betel nuts (one type of mouth freshener).

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband. Over time, they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in their community. She is a responsible mother of five children and is able to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in large quantities, she applied for a loan of 60,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation.  In this way, they would be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing home more cash. She dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in large quantities.

loans.name: Jose Eligio

texts.es:
José Eligio tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores patos, gallinas y cerdos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposa le ayuda en esta labor los fines de semana va hasta las comunidades aledañas a ofrecer los mismos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la construcción de corrales y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Eligio is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Oyotun District, two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the northern coastal area of Peru. The people of his city work in agriculture, business and ranching.

José Eligio raises and sells small animals such as turkeys, chickens and pigs in back of his home. His wife helps him with this work, going around to neighboring communities on the weekends to sell the animals.

He has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles to purchase animal feed and build corrals. By doing this he will have better product to offer his customers, generating a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and build corrals.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno is a widow and has two children. Her daughter is 17 years old, and her son is 14 years old. 

Barno has worked in a café as a cook for more than eight years. She lives with her children poorly, as she has a small salary. Barno’s daughter graduated school, and now she wants to go to Russia to find a job. 

Barno does not have money to buy an airplane ticket for her daughter. She is asking for a loan of 2,200 somoni to buy a ticket for her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket for her daughter.

loans.name: Antonio María

texts.es:
Don Antonio es un hombre emprendedor, de 56 años de edad, que lleva más de 6 años en el comercio. A través de su negocio busca generar los recursos que tanto necesita para poder comprarse una casa propia y continuar ayudando en la educación de sus dos hijos. Con el crédito busca poder comprar el inventario que le está haciendo falta en su tienda para la temporada de fin de año, lo cual incluye frutas, verduras y gaseosas entre otras cosas.

Es un trabajador incansable, que con jornadas de 14 horas diarias, de Lunes a Domingo, persigue el sueño que tanto anhela, y es poder crecer su negocio y dejarlo como un legado familiar que le asegure el sostenimiento a su familia y una vejez digna.
texts.en:
Antonio is an enterprising man.  He is 56 years old and has been a merchant for six years.  He generates income that he needs to buy a house and to continue helping with his two children’s educations.  He will use the money from this loan to buy what he needs for the end of the year season, including fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, and other things.

He is a tireless, hardworking man who works 14 hours a day, seven days a week.  He is pursuing his dream of growing his business and leaving is as a family legacy that will ensure his support in his old age.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik is from Janfida village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and two grown-up children (ages 22 and 18). 

Goharik is a nurse by profession. She works at a local hospital as a nurse and also provides nursing services to individuals from her house. Realizing the importance of the service that she provides, Goharik works really hard to be able to provide better quality service. Currently, Goharik needs financial support for being able to purchase new tools and devices for providing better service to her clients. 

Goharik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will be a great help for Goharik and the whole village, as with new devices, she will be able to expand the variety of nursing services she provides.

loans.use: to pay for tools and devices for providing nursing services.

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme de 37 mariée mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait l’élevage des poulets qu'elle revend depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Son élevage fonctionne bien elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle au fil du temps. elle s’accroît au jour le jour et elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui lui permettra non seulement d'augmenter son stock de poussin, mais aussi de se procurer la provende pour leur nutrition. cela augmentera ses ventes surtout avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année ainsi que son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses revenus dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine, age 37, is married and the mother of a family. She's a merchant and, for three years, she's been raising chickens to resell in a neighborhood of the capital.

Her chicken-raising business is doing well and, over time, she has acquired a loyal clientele, which is increasing day by day, so that she cannot meet customer demand anymore.

This loan is thus of importance to her, since it will enable her to both increase the number of chicks she has, and buy chicken feed for them.
