texts.ru: Токтокан 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. Токтокан многодетная и счастливая мать. Три сына находятся на заработках в России, ежемесячно высылают часть зарплаты на поддержание семьи, остальные дети -школьники, учатся и в свободное время помогают Токтокан по хозяйству. Супруг изготавливает из дерева национальный музыкальный инструмент, который называется комуз. Очень мало людей, которые могут изготавливать такие инструменты и супруг Токтокан входит в число этих людей. Изготавливает комузы на заказ, имеет небольшой доход. У Токтокан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтокан занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан и ее детей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 нетель, 5 овец, 10 коз. Также на территории дома у Токтокан  имеется небольшой сад с яблонями и сливами. Осенью после сбора урожая Токтокан  варит варенье и компоты для своей семьи из яблок и слив. А оставшуюся часть фруктов и ягод реализует продавцам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). У Токтокан очень дружная и музыкальная семья, супруг Токтокан сам изготавливает, играет и поет на комузе, дети подпевают. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтокан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для домашнего скота взамен старого.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 46 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up six children. Toktokan is a happy mother with many children. Three sons are working abroad in Russia and they send part of their salary every month to support the family. The remaining children are school age, and in their free time help Toktokan around the homestead. Her husband manufactures national musical instruments called "komuz" from wood. Very few people can manufacture such instruments and Toktokan's husband is among them. He makes komuzes on order and has a small income.

Toktokan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Toktokan raises livestock, having started 13 years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to the hard work of Toktokan and her children, the homestead currently has: one heifer, five sheep, and ten goats. Also on the territory of the house, Toktokan has a small garden with apple and plum trees. In the autumn after collecting the crop, Toktokan prepares jam and compotes for her family from apples and plums. And the remaining portion of fruit and berries are sold. Monthly income consists of 20,000 som (KGS).

Toktokan has a very friendly and musical family: Toktokan's husband himself manufactures, plays and sings with the komuz and the children sign along.

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Toktokan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy sheep to increase the livestock headcount.

Toktokan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the construction of a new building for livestock to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Kenjegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Кенжегул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кенжегул занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кенжегул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку коров для откорма и реализации по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кенжегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kenjegul is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up four children. Kenjegul has a high school educaiton. As a main source of income for her family, Kenjegul raises cattle, having begun 17 year ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kenjegul currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow and one calf. Monthly income consists of 5,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kenjegul applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for fattening and selling at a high price.

Kenjegul plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the number of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés vive en la casa de sus Padres en la zona Leon de la ciudad de El Alto.
Andrés se dedica a la confeccion de ropas de bebe y chalecos en su propio domicilio, y  necesita el crédito para compra de una maquina overlock. Asi incrementara mucho mas su produccion pues acabará la confección mucho más rápido y tendrá opción a mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Andrés es tener un taller amplio de costura, asi mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés lives in his parents' house in the León area of the city of El Alto.

Andrés earns a living making baby clothes and vests in his own home.  He needs the loan to buy an overlock machine, which will increase his production a lot because he'll finish much more quickly and be able to improve his income.

Andrés's dream is to have a large tailor shop to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine for his business making baby clothes and vests

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y etc. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes. 

(La ciudad de Pilco - Grande está ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Eduarda is grateful to the lenders for their offered support and for the loan, because it helped her to increase her working capital. She continues working in agriculture, livestock farming and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, etc. This time, she needs the loan in order to purchase small animals like guinea pigs.

(The city of Pilco - Grande is located in the district of Challabamba within the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pics, etc.

loans.name: Sumaq Paqari Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “SUMAQ PAQARI” en la comunidad de Cotañi. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado y a la crianza de animales menores. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

José nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica principal es la albañilería, a la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, él tambien se dedica a la artesanía o sea hace chulos, mantas, chalinas a base de lana de alpaca y oveja. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumaq Paqari” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y oveja. 

La comunidad de Cotañi pertenece al distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú). 

(La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía se tuvo que tomarla su fotografía en otro día).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the village bank "Sumac Paqari" in the community of Cotañi. This bank is made up of people who are always looking for an opportunity to get ahead, and to give their children a better future by working hard every day. The members work in farming, livestock, food sales, cattle fattening and small animal husbandry. The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them and promise to make their payments in the established time periods.

José, 43, was born in the community of Cotañi and still lives there. He is married and has five children. He is a hardworking and dedicated person who gets ahead through a lot of effort and work. His main work is as a mason, and also farming, livestock and small animal husbandry. He raises animals like sheep, cows, guinea pigs, pigs and hens. He also is an artisan, making hats, blankets and scarves from alpaca and sheep's wool.

He has been a member of the "Sumaq Paqair" village bank for some years, and on this occasion he needs a loan to buy alpaca and sheep wool.

The community of Cotañi belongs to the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú. The person at the bottom of the photograph had to take her picture on another day.

loans.use: to buy sheep and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos continua perteneciendo al banco comunal YANAPAKUY y sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra de y venta de madera, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carlos continues as a member of Yanapakuy Communal Bank and still works in his business buying and selling wood.  He has had this business for some time and it's going well for him because of the effort he puts into it every day.  He wants to be able to keep on working so he can continue to support his family.

Carlos is requesting the loan to buy wood.

He's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Villa Rayanniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicia ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Villa rayaniyoc.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Villa Rayaniyoc communal bank. This group is located in the Taray district, which is part of Calca province in Cusco department.

The borrower is Felicia. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. The borrower works in her business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them, watches them grow, and then sells them in the various markets. By means of this small business, she is raising her children. The borrower's dream is to have a place to sell her guinea pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

The borrower whose face is covered with a circle no longer belongs to the Villa Rayaniyoc communal bank.

The other members have businesses such as selling animals, agriculture, grocery store and selling vegetables.

The borrower is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way, and promises to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío Chaupe una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que se encuentra en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de maíz y menestras desde hace ocho años, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos, con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilson is 35 years old. He lives with his wife in Caserío Chaupe, a rural area in the district of Querocotillo. The community is characterized by agriculture, commerce, and ranching, and is located two hours from the city of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region in the mountainous northern region of Perú.

He makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and beans for 8 years. He is an enterprising father. He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to maintain his crops by purchasing fertilizer and pay workers to harvest his corn crops. This way, he will have an appropriate harvest to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to maintain his crops and to pay workers to harvest his corn corps.

loans.name: Jovanny

texts.es:
Jovanny tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Chulucanas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la elaboración de artesanías, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se pertenece a la Provincia de Morropon, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una tienda donde se dedican a la comercialización de frutas, abarrotes y ropa, su esposo se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, son una familia emprendedora, Jovanny ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar ropa de temporada primavera- verano y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jovanny, age 36, lives with her husband in the Chulucanas district.  The community is known for making handicrafts, and the population works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

She and her husband have a store where they sell fruit, groceries, and clothes.  Her husband raises and sells livestock.  

Jovanny has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy clothes for the spring-summer season.  She will offer them to her customers in order to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the spring-summer season.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as being patient. 

Elly operates a retail store where he sells spare parts for electronics. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a viable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

Elly will use the KES 50,000 loan to add a stock of electronic spare parts. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. 

This is Elly's third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). His previous loan of KES 50,000 was successfully repaid. Elly will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add a stock of electronic spare parts to his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She describes herself as an outgoing person. 

Gladys operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, bananas, coconuts, onions, etc. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit six family members. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposa e hijo de 4 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para fomentar la economía de la familia. Su sueño es comprarse un terrero.
Le gusta mirar la televisión y trabajar.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old and is in a common law marriage. He lives with his wife and his 4-year-old son. They live in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. 

The "San Nicolas" communal bank is located in the community of San Nicolas which belongs to Ricaurte Parish, Urdaneta Canton. The members work in agriculture and livestock. 

Luis works in agriculture and has been cultivating corn and rice for a couple of years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells them on the market there. He is asking for a credit to buy manure and fertilizers for his cultivation of corn and rice. The loan will help him to increase the income of his family.

His dream is to buy land. He enjoys watching television and he likes his work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Amada Felicita

texts.es:
Amada tiene 61 años de edad de estado civil Soltera tiene un hijo vive con los hijos en el Recinto Desvio De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvio de los Amarillos , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Amada se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, urea, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alimento para los animales balanceado de engorde y crianza. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es trabajar mas para tener una mejor vida economica, le gusta mucho leer la biblia y predicar la palabra de dios.
texts.en:
Amada is 61 years old. Her marital status is single. She has one son. She lives with her children in Recinto Desvio de los Amarillo, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

She belongs to the solidarity group Pequenos Agricultores, located in Recinto Desvio de los Amarillos, within the canton of Ventanas. She works farming and raising livestock. 

As a farmer, Amada grows corn and raises animals like chicken and pigs. This loan will allow her to buy supplies like fertilizer, urea, insecticides to avoid pests and diseases, and also balanced feed to raise and fatten her animals. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to keep working in order to have a better financial life. She enjoys reading the Bible and preaching God's Word.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, pesticides, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es madre cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo y toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella; vive con sus hijos a los que sacó adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Desde hace más de 25 años se desenvuelve en el campo de la confección, inició trabajando como operaria en una empresa pero, con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos, tomó la iniciativa de independizarse y, desde hace 8 años montó su propio taller, ubicado en su vivienda, presta el servicio de confección a terceros, elaborando conjuntos deportivos y uniformes, cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada a la que le paga por horas: de esta forma, ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar todas las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar una máquina plana industrial e insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar su capacidad instalada y aumentar la producción, además tendrá los insumos necesarios para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en el mes de enero, cuando vende uniformes; esto le dará la posibilidad de generar mejores ingresos.
Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir acreditando su negocio y, en un futuro se proyecta en la ampliación del mismo, para que le permita generar más oportunidades de empleo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de los que ama.
texts.en:
Luz is a mother and the head of the household since she separated from her husband and all the economic responsibility fell on her. She lives with her children whom she raised with much effort and dedication. For more than 25 years she has been involved in the field of garment making. She began working as an operator in a business, but with the courage to improve her income, she took the initiative to become independent, and eight years ago she set up her own workshop. It is located in her home, and she offers garment-making services for wholesalers, making sports outfits and uniforms. She has the help of an employee whom she pays by the hour. In this way, she has generated sufficient resources to pay for all the household necessities.

Now she needs the help of a loan to buy a flatbed industrial sewing machine and wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, buttons, and elastic, among other items). This will allow her to improve her installed capacity and increase production. In addition, she will have the supplies necessary to satisfy the demand that increases in the month of January, when she sells uniforms. This will give her the possibility of generating better income.

Luz states that her greatest wish is to continue strengthening her business, and in the future she projects its expansion, so that it will allow her to generate more employment opportunities and improve the living conditions of those she loves.

loans.use: to buy an industrial flatbed sewing machine and wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, buttons, and elastic, among other items)

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es madre soltera de un hijo adolescente de 16 años de edad, a quien ha sacado adelante sola con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
Dese hace 8 años, tomó la iniciativa de montar su propio negocio, idea que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para solventar los gastos del hogar; por eso, con unos ahorros que tenía, inició una tienda de abarrotes en la que ofrece muchos productos de la canasta familiar, trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 10 pm, así obtiene ingresos para velar por el bienestar de su hijo. 
Su actitud positiva, su perseverancia y el amor por su hijo, la motivan día a día para seguir trabajando arduamente, por ello solicita el crédito como un apoyo para acreditar mejor su negocio, con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (granos, café, gaseosas, azúcar, galletería, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse con mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes diversas alternativas que satisfagan sus gustos y necesidades, logrando mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que percibe con ellas. 
Marleny sueña con seguir fortaleciendo aún más su negocio, pues éste se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos y sueña con verla bien organizada, con más surtido para mejorar la rentabilidad y darle permanencia en el tiempo y, así garantizar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Marleny is a single mother of a 16 year old son, who she has brought up solely with great effort and dedication.

Eight years ago she took the initiative to start her own business; an idea that grew out of the necessity to generate income in order to meet household expenses. So with some savings that she had, she started a grocery store, which offers many household products. Working daily from 7am to 10pm, she there by earned the income necessary to ensure the welfare of her child.

Her positive attitude, perseverance and love for her son motivate her every day in order to keep working hard. She is requesting a loan a means of support to better establish her business. With the money she will buy wholesale stock (grain, coffee, soda, sugar, biscuits, etc.) so that she can stock up on greater variety in order to offer her clients a various alternatives that suit their needs and tastes, achieving better sales and the earnings that come with them.

Marleny dreams of going on strengthening her business, as it has become her only source of income and she dreams of seeing it well organised with more assortment in order to improve profitability and make it permanent, thereby ensuring a better quality of life and wellbeing for her son.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock (grain, coffee, soda, sugar, biscuits, etc.)

loans.name: Rosa Estella

texts.es: Ella es Rosa Stella, está en 4 semestre de enfermería se siente muy contenta de estar estudiando este técnico porque en sus rotaciones a aprendido mucho y ha encontrado personas maravillosas que le han enseñado, su familia está conformada por 3 hermanos, su mamá y un sobrino ella es la menor, su papá murió hace 12 años cuando ella tan solo tenía 7 años, sufrí mucho por la pérdida de su padre, pero lo fue superando con el tiempo, su  mamá los sacó adelante con mucho sacrificio por que hizo de papá y mamá en una etapa muy difícil que fue el crecimiento de ellos, hoy en día son unas personas consientes de la vida con metas y proyectos en mente para ahora ser ellos los que ayuden a su mamá, rosa le da gracias a su madre por estarle pagando su estudio y apoyándola en lo que a ella le gusta,pero ahora no tiene los modos financieros para pagar su semestre y  eso es lo que ellos necesitan para poder salir adelante una familia que les de concejos y alientos para culminar sus proyectos, quiere ser una buena enfermera tener méritos en su trabajo y destacarse por lo que hace y por su forma de ser, uno de sus sueños es conocer muchos países y culturas diferentes y también quiere estudiar inglés para ir a trabajar a Estados Unidos y tener una buena estabilidad económica, ahora que su mamá no vive con ella se ha dado cuenta que no es nada fácil porque, rosa acostumbrada a verla todos los días, pero eso la hace más fuerte y valorar  más a su madre, está más pendiente de ella, rosa cree que para algunas personas es aterrador que su mamá se allá ido de la casa, y pensaran que se fue por problemas en el hogar y no es así, su  mamá lo hizo para que ellos se hicieran más responsables de sus cosas y de la casa que su papá les dejó, y si, ella se ha dado cuenta que se han hecho cargo de la casa eso para ella es muy chévere, puede decir que tiene la familia más hermosa porque son muy unidos y están más  pendientes uno del otro y la mamá más hermosa porque los quiere y los cuida mucho y espera que siga así por muchos años más. Con este técnico tendrá un futuro asegurado y la satisfacción de que su tiempo no fue desperdiciado si no aprovechado para su desarrollo personal e integral y seguir estudiando en esta área de la salud que es lo que a ella le gusta hacer ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus cuidados.Le agradece a kiva si la pueden ayudar para poder terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa Estella is in her fourth semester of nursing school. She feels very happy to be studying this profession because she has learned a lot in her rotations and she has encountered marvelous people who have taught her. 

Her family consists of three siblings, her mother and a nephew. She is the youngest. Her father died 12 years ago when she was only seven years old. She suffered greatly because of the loss of her father, but she overcame it with time. Her mother sacrificed a lot to raise them, because she played the role of father and mother during a very difficult stage of their growth. However, now she does not have the finanial means to pay for her semester of school. Today they are people who are very aware of their life goals, with projects in mind to now be the ones who are helping their mother. 

Rosa is thankful to her mother for paying for her education and supporting her in what she likes, because that is what they need to advance as a family - to give each other advice and encouragement to complete their projects. However, now she lacks the financial resources to pay this semester. Rosa wants to be a good nurse, to be recognized at work, and to stand out for what she does and how she carries herself. One of her dreams is to get to know many countries and different cultures. She also wants to study English to go and work in the United States and have economic stability. 

Now that Rosa does not live with her mother, she has come to realize that it is not easy. Rosa was accustomed to seeing her mother every day, but being apart has made her stronger and made her appreciate her mother more. She is more dependent on her. Rosa believes that for some people it is worrisome that their mother does not live at the house, and they think it is because of household problems. However, this is not the case. Her mother wanted her children to be more responsible for their things and the house which their father left to them. Rosa has realized that to be responsible for the house is fantastic. She can say that she has the most wonderful family because they are very unified and more dependent on each other, and she has the loveliest mother who loves them and cares for them greatly, and she hopes that this will continue for many years more.

With her technical training, Rosa will have her future secured and the satisfaction that her time was not wasted but rather well used for her personal development. She wants to continue studying this area of health because she enjoys helping other people who need her care. She thanks Kiva for helping her to be able to finish her studies.

loans.use: to help pay for a semester of school to finish her studies

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
En este momento para erica campo alto es su única opción ya que por sus facilidades de pago su mama puede colaborar para salir adelante, ya que hasta ahora se graduó del colegio y no tiene la facilidad de entrar a una universidad.
Su mama es madre soltera y vive únicamente con ella y al poder estudiar administración en salud en campo alto, puede aspirar a tener un futuro en el que pueda ayudara su mama.
su mama no tiene un sueldo fijo, ya que trabaja como vendedora ambulante, por lo tanto tiene sisben y estudio en un colegio oficial.
Espera le puedan colaborar, ya que por lo anterior no puede pagar una cuota tan alta.

Gracias
texts.en:
At present, Campo Alto is the only option for Erica, as because of its payment terms, her mother can contribute to her success. So far she has graduated from high school and does not have the means to enter university. 

Her mother is single, and it is just the two of them. By being able to study health administration at Campo Alto, she can aspire to have a future where she can help her mother. Her mother has no steady income and works as a street vendor. She has been given social security benefits and studies at a public high school. She hopes they can contribute to her education, since as has outlined above, she cannot afford such a high fee. Thank you.

loans.use: To complete her studies.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Alejandro se considera una persona responsable, trabajadora y humanitaria. Está casado desde hace 21 años y juntos tienen tres hijos de 21,19 y 17 años; sólo su hijo de 19 años aún vive con ellos. Él vive en casa de familiares desde hace 22 años.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para dama desde hace 15 años, ya que a su esposa le gustaba pero él fue quien comenzó vendiendo con sus vecinas y ahora con sus compañeros de la base de taxis. Afortunadamente les va muy bien ya que traen ropa por pedido y maneja un sistema en pagos con sus clientes.

Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercancía de acuerdo a esta temporada, como son cobijas y colchas. Su mayor logro es tener el negocio hasta el día de hoy y su principal meta es comprar su casa propia .
texts.en:
Alejandro is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story: Alejandro is seen as a responsible, hard-working and humanitarian person. He has been married for 21 years and they have three children aged 17, 19 and 21 years. He has lived in the house of a family member for 22 years.

Alejandro has been selling woman's clothing for the past 15 years. as his wife enjoys it. But it was him who started selling to his neighbors and now to his co-workers at the taxi company. Fortunately things have been going well for them. They sell clothing on order and have a system of credit for their customers.

This loan is needed to buy seasonal merchandise such as blankets and quilts. His main achievement is to have run his business up to now and his dream is to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise like blankets and quilts.

loans.name: Ol'ga

texts.ru:
Ольга  занимается фермерством.  Свою деятельность начала с выращивания молодой картошки в 1998 году.
В семье Ольги четверо детей и муж, самому старшему сыну 37 лет, он работает главным ветврачом района, а младшей дочке 20 лет, она работает продавцом в продуктовом магазине.
По хозяйству справляться ей помогает муж.
Сейчас Ольга на своем участке в 25 соток, выращивает молодой картофель, морковь, свеклу и укроп.
Так как есть проблемы с поливом земельного участка, Ольга с мужем решила приобрести  капельную ленту и магистральную трубу для полива.
В планах на будущее Ольги, приобрести мотопомпу и построить накопитель для воды, это позволит обеспечить без перебойную  подачу теплой воды. 
В личных планах Ольги достроить жилой  дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования магистральной трубы и капельной ленты.
texts.en:
Ol'ga is involved with farming. Her activities began with growing young potatoes in 1998.

In Ol'ga's family, there are four children and her husband. The oldest son, who is 37 years old, works as the chief veterinarian in the region, and the youngest daughter, 20 years old, works as a clerk in a grocery store.

Her husband helps her to cope with the work around the farm.

Now, Ol'ga on her plot of 25 acres grows young potatoes, carrots, beets and dill.

Since there is a problem with irrigating the plot of land, Ol'ga and her husband decided to acquire drip tape and the main pipe for irrigation.

Ol'ga's Future Plans: to buy a motorpump and build a driver for the water. This will ensure no break in the flow of warm water.

Ol'ga's Personal Plans: to build a house.

She needs help to finance the main pipe and drip tape.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Mastira

texts.ru: Мастира 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Сыновьям: Дастанбеку - 18 лет, Шергазы - 12 лет, Эрлану - 10 лет; дочерям: Жылдыз - 17 лет, Зире - 6 лет. Все дети помогают по хозяйству. Супруг помогает по хозяйству, в сезонное время, а это осенью и летом подрабатывает строителем на частных стройках. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Каждый член семьи пытается внести свой вклад в развитие благоустройства своей семьи. Сама Мастира по характеру очень трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и просто заботливая и добрая мать. У Мастиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мастира занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мастиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также в активах имеет 0,45 ГА земельной доли, на которой выращивает кукурузу, картошку, клевер. У Мастиры и ее семьи очень большой опыт в животноводстве и полеводстве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мастира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Мастира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома, где она проживает со своей большой дружной семьей.
texts.en:
Mastira is 41 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up five children. The sons: Dastanbeku - 18 years old, Shergazi - 12, Erlanu - 10; the daughters: Zhyldyz - 17, Zire - 6. All the children help around the homestead. Her husband helps around the homestead in season, and during the spring and summer earns additionally as a builder on private construction sites. They live as one big happy family. Every member of the family tries to do his part in developing the well-being of the family.

Mastira herself by character is very hardworking, purposeful and a simply loving and good mother. Mastira has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Mastira is involved in raising livestock and cultivating crops, having begun ten years ago with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Mastira currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, and also has in assets a 0.45-hectare plot of land, on which she grows corn, potatoes, and clover. Mastira and her family have quite a lot of experience in livestock and crop cultivation. Monthly income consists of 9,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Mastira applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for fattening and subsequent resale at the market at a premium.

Mastira plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the number of domestic animals, and also in the future intends to do repairs on the home where she lives with her large friendly family.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 61-year-old widow whose children are now grown up and married. She runs a cereal business that earns her a monthly income of KES 12,000. She ventured into the business ten years ago and says the business has helped her educate her children. 

Mary is requesting a first loan of KES 10,000 to add more cereals in her business. She dreams of living a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 35-years-old from Olkalou. He is married to Miriam and they are blessed with three children aged 13, nine and five years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last 13 years.  To enable him to buy some fertilizers and pesticides to spray his vegetables for maximum yields, he has applied for his fifth loan of KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya.  His monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and his plan is to use the profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children.

In the future, Wilson hopes to be a successful farmer in his region.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetables

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is a married woman. She describes herself as being God-fearing. 

Mercyline operates a tailoring shop where she makes new clothes to sell. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of water. 

Mercyline will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit five family members. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables to sell. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be inadequate water supply. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water pump and pipes for pumping water to her farm.This will enable her to have a constant supply of water in her farm. This will benefit 10 family members. 

She hopes that in the future, she will extend her farming area. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water pump and pipes

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman. She describes herself to be creative. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of water. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank for storing clean water for domestic use. This will benefit seven family members. 

She hopes that in the future, she will access water easily. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45 year old married woman with 3 children between the ages of 16 and 20. She describes herself as determined. She has operated a grocery store for 10 years to local residents. 

Her biggest business challenge is lack of funds to increase her stock of vegetables. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase vegetables. 

Margaret hopes that in the future, she will continue her employment. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES  was  successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to increase her stock.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: En neumáticos para motocicletas y carros, invirtió Santiago su credikiva anterior, con ello logró tener más inventarios de repuestos y prestar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Sus ventas aumentaron y mejoró su calidad de vida, por eso satisfecho, planea hacer un nuevo financiamiento, para responder con nuevos inventarios de repuestos y llantería en general, destinados a mejorar los vehículos de sus clientes etc.  Por lo cual acude a un credikiva,  a fin de lograr nuevamente hacerlo exitoso.
texts.en: Santiago invested his prior Kiva loan in motorcycle and car tires.  With this, he managed to have a wider stock of spare parts available and offer better service to his clientele.  His sales increased and he improved his quality of life.  Pleased with this, he is planning to take out a new loan, to restock parts and tires in general, intended to improve his customers’ vehicles.  Because of this he is turning to a Kiva loan, with the goal of being successful once again.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and tires.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernan tiene una meta y es la de hacer mas productivo su negocio de venta de alimentos, actividad que nació desde al año 2008, producto de la experiencia de su madre, a quien ha visto haciendo almuerzos, desde que él era muy niño. Hoy ya adulto, Hernan inicia su día laboral desde las 7 de la mañana y termina a las 3 de la tarde, porque su producto exclusivo son los almuerzos, y los ofrece a sus clientes, todos los días sin cesar, desde lunes a sábados. El compra de contado y   a mayoristas  y vende a empleados de empresa, su sueño es tener contratos para aumentar sus ingresos. En la actualidad se ha acercada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará insumos, como aceite, arroz, cárnicos etc, en un mayor volumen, con el fin de hacer  efectivo sus compras y no depender de la recuperación del dinero, producto de sus ventas, para poder servir mejor a su clientela.  Y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión se proyecte muy exitosa.
texts.en: Hernan's goal is to make the food business he started in 2008 more productive. The business is the product of his mother's experience, because he has watched her prepare lunches since he was a very young boy. Now as an adult, Hernan starts the work day at 7 AM and finishes at 3 PM. Lunches are his only product and he sells to his customers every day Monday through Saturday without exception. He buys from wholesalers in installments and sells to the employees of businesses, and his dream is to increase his income through contracts. Currently he has contacted the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to apply for a credikiva, which is the first loan he has applied for at this organization, and with it he will purchase larger quantities of ingredients like oil, rice, meat, etc. The objective is to pay for his purchases outright and not have to wait to recoup money from sales, so as to provide a better service to his customers. That's exactly why he sees a very successful outcome for his investment.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like oil, rice, meat, etc

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 29-year-old, hardworking married man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a bar, a business he started in order to raise money to support his family. Being a good father, he desires to educate his children at the college degree level. Price fluctuations and the high cost of rent pose a challenge to his business. His desire is to own a modern bar that attracts executive customers. Moses is requesting for a loan to buy drinks such as sodas and beer ahead of the Christmas season, which is characterized by increased sales.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as sodas and beer ahead of the Christmas season, which is characterized by increased sales.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two school-aged children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a clothing shop, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Saumu is requesting for a loan to purchase bales of clothing for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Dorfine

texts.en:
Dorfine operates a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby in addition she sells sporting goods to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. The previous loan helped her to boost her business and she appreciates the support. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Dorfine wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, milk, cooking fat, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, milk, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a rural housewife of 24 years, and she has completed primary education. She lives with her two sons and one daughter and her husband, Nirmal. They live in the small village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made). They are providing education to their two children who are students of grade 2 and grade 7. The third one is below the school-going age.

Sumitra's husband is a farmer by profession. He attended school up to grade 5. He grows green vegetables like beans, chilies, bitter gourd, etc. on his ancestral land and sells them in the local market. It is the main source of income for the family.  Sumitra also helps her husband in his agricultural work, after managing her household work. However, the income from their agribusiness is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family.

To continue running the agribusiness in a sustainable way and grow other vegetables, they need to make some investments. Sumitra has taken a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of potatoes on their land, besides other vegetables. They hope to earn additional profit, as the product has a good potential in the present market.

Sumitra plans to utilize the profit to give a better financial condition to her family, educate her children so that they can go ahead in life, and in the future, upgrade their house in to a pacca (concrete-made) one.

She and her husband are thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Los Agricultores De Crucete Group

texts.es:
Osmar, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo y reside en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la producción de maíz, esta producción la vende en el mercado local y obtiene sus propios ingresos. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo en forma grupal que en lo personal solicita 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su propósito es seguir trabajando para darle lo mejor a su familia. 
El grupo se llama Los Agricultores de Crucete, que esta integrado por cinco miembros que también se dedican al cultivo de maíz y viven en la misma comunidad. Cada uno solicita un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras, haciendo un total de 50,000, con el cual van a comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda es Manuel, José Elio de camisa azul, José Osmar de camisa amarilla, Melvin de camisa manga larga a la derecha y atrás esta Osmar.
texts.en:
Osmar, 37, lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has a child.  They live in the municipality of Olanchito.  For 25 years, he has been cultivating corn.  He sells his crops in the local market to obtain his income.  He is requesting a second loan within his communal bank, from which he will take a sum of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to buy fertilizers to cultivate corn.  This way, he can get a better harvest.  His goal is to continue to work to provide the best for his family.

Osmar's communal bank is names "Los Agricultores de Crucete."  This group has 4 other members who also cultivate corn and live in the same community. Each of them is requesting a sum of 10,000 Honduran lempiras, so the total group loan is for 50,000 lempiras.  Each member will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve their crops.  

In the photo, they are identified as follows: on the left is Manuel, Jose Elio is wearing a blue shirt, Jose Osmar is wearing a yellow shirt, Melvin is in the long-sleeved shirt on the right, and standing behind the others is Osmar.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn crops

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es: Teresita, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo, padres y hermanos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una máquina de coser, la cual le facilite la elaboración de ropa y así poder aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones por medio del INA y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de telas y otras productos, y también lograr un mejor acabado a las prendas fabricadas, además de aumentar la cantidad de unidades confeccionadas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más ropa y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Teresita is 26 years old, single, and lives with her son, parents, and siblings who are her main priority.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a sewing machine, which she will use to make clothing and be able to take advantage of the training through INA.  She will also be able to buy fabrics and other supplies so she can better finish her clothing and increase her production.  With this she will be able to make more clothing and fulfill more orders in the short term.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carlos Ignacio

texts.es:
Carlos Ignacio es cliente Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Carlos tiene 30 años y es soltero, él se dedica al servicio de transporte en mototaxi desde hace 12 años. 

Él es dueño de 5 mototaxi que operan en una unidad habitacional, da a trabajar cuatro de esas unidades y él opera la otra. Inició con bicicletas y poco a poco logró adquirir motos. Este préstamo lo pide para comprar más motos, darlas a trabajar y así tener mayores ingresos. 

Con el esfuerzo de su negocio Carlos quiere obtener beneficios en su vida personal, mejorar algunas bicicletas que le quedan a motocicletas y su reto es adquirir un taxi.
texts.en:
Carlos Ignacio is a customer of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Carlos is 30 years old and single. For 12 years he has worked in run a mototaxi business.

He is the owner of five mototaxis which operate in a housing complex, giving work to four of its residents as well as himself. He began with bicycles and little by little was able to buy motorbikes. He is asking for a loan to buy more motorbikes to provide more work for the community and earn a greater income.

Through his hard work in his business, Carlos hopes to improve his personal life and to trade some of the bicycles he still has for motorbikes. His goal is to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to buy motorbikes for his business.

loans.name: Pius' Group

texts.en:
Pius is a member of Lukwa Group in Webuye District.  He is in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent 21 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Pius has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	

Pius is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  He is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Pius has been a farmer for 20 years.  He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

Pius joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Pius joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, receive fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and his send children to school.  Because he likes being a leader and an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Pius has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved his life because he has earned more profits from his harvest, has more farm training and farm group support, and is able to save money and  feed the family.  In the future, Pius hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, and buy a cow. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Pius and the Lukwa Group will use the loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and this loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Rebeca tiene 25 años, es divorciada y tiene una hija. Ella inició su negocio hace un año ya que le gusta bastante la repostería, lo que la motiva a dedicarse a la venta de postres. 

Ella vende fresas con crema, duraznos con crema, gelatinas de agua y leche, flan napolitano y pastel. Ya que inició su negocio hace poco pide este préstamo para comprar utensilio de cocina para darle mejor presentación a sus postres y así incrementar sus ventas. 

Con el trabajo en su negocio Rebeca quiere sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is her story:

Rebeca, 25, is divorced and has a daughter. A year ago, she started selling desserts because she liked making them. She sells strawberries with cream, peaches with cream, jellos made with water and milk, Napoleon flan, and pastries. Since she recently started the business, she is applying for this loan to buy kitchen utensils to make her desserts look more appealing and increase sales. Rebeca wants to support her daughter through her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to make her desserts look more appealing.

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Madame Mbène, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont trois garçons qui sont majeurs et qui travaillent et appui dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Mbène fait du commerce depuis 5 ans période à laquelle elle a commencé à solliciter des crédits à IMCEC. Son commerce consiste à acheter du mil, de l’arachide, de l’oseille, de le garder jusqu'à la période de pénurie pour pouvoir le revendre à des prix plus élevé. Avec son financement elle compte acheter ces meme produits qu'elle commercialise  et va les revendre sur le marché. Elle n’a pas de charges car elle a ses enfants qui s’occupent de la dépense quotidienne et des petits besoins de la famille. Mbène aimerait dans l’avenir diversifier, ses activités et utiliser sa boutique pour faire autre chose que du stockage.
texts.en:
Madame Mbène is married and the mother of five children. Three of her children are boys who are of age. They work and help out with the management of the day-to-day expenses.

Mbène started her business five years ago. At that time, she began requesting loans from IMCEC. Her business consists of buying millet, peanuts, and sorrel until there's a shortage. She then sells her goods a higher price. With the funding she plans to buy these products to sell on the market.

She does not have expenses as her children take care of the day-to-day expenses and the small needs of the family. 

In the future, Mbène would like to diversify her business and use her boutique for other uses besides stocking inventory.

loans.use: buy millet cereal, peanuts, and sorrel for resale

loans.name: Ana Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana forma parte desde hace 10 años del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, vive por un sector perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este sector es muy turístico ya que es el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio. Le gusta estar en su grupo ya que todas tienen una muy buena amistad, comparten gratos momentos y se ayudan mutuamente.
La Señora Ana tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo es jubilado y labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Ana se dedica a las tareas de la casa, cría cuyes y gallinas, cultiva y las cosechas son para consumo de su hogar y para la venta, también se dedica a la costura de todo tipo de prenda de vestir.
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela y en alimento para sus animales. Su sueño es continuar creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Ana has been part of the credit group sector, 3 Marías, for 10 years. She lives in a sector that belongs to the the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This is an area with a lot of tourists, as it looks out over the city. The people there work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. She likes being in her group because they all have a good friendship, they share pleasant moments, and they help each other.

Señora Ana is 63 years old, married, and her through her marriage she has had 6 children. Four of them are married and live independently, and her two daughters, who are single, work and help her financially.  Her husband is retired and works in agriculture, and they own their home.

Doña Ana does housework, raises guinea pigs and chickens, and grows produce to eat at home and to sell. She also sews, making any type of garment. 

She is going to use her loan to purchase fabric and animal feed. Her dream is to continue growing in her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and animal feed.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes Malena ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos como refrigeradoras, lavadoras, ollas y cocinas, la socia trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de elecdromesticos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cocinas, refrigeradoras y ollas.

El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de imprenta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de electrodomésticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Señor de los Temblores Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Lourdes Malena, 35, lives with her companion and has two children.  She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. in her business selling appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, ovens, and stoves.  She has been in this business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her appliance business.

Lourdes Malena is requesting the loan to buy stoves, refrigerators, and ovens.
 
The member that is added to the photo took the photo later on. He obtained permission to do this because he had work obligations.

The other members earn a living in fruit sales, a printing business, a grocery store, and appliance sales.

Lourdes Malena is grateful to those who share her dream through this loan and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy stoves, refrigerators, and ovens

loans.name: Rosa Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa desde hace tres años realiza créditos a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque le permite salir de la rutina de su trabajo y compartir gratos momentos con sus amigas. Vive por un sector perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este sector es muy turístico ya que es el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.
La Señora. Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 18, 17 y 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y estudian, su tercera hija es casada y vive independiente, su último hijo estudia en el colegio, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia. 
Doña Rosa se dedica a las tareas de su hogar, cría pollos, cerdos y cuyes, también cultiva y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y también lo vende.
Esta repitiendo su crédito que es para comprar alimento sus pollos ya que tiene un criadero grande. Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa has for the past three years taken out loans with her friends and colleagues from the Sector 3 Marías Communal Bank. She is pleased with this type of loan because it allows her step away from her work routine and spend a little time with her friends.

Doña Rosa is 41 and married to a bricklayer who works in the construction industry. The couple owns their own home and are the parents of four children, ages 21, 18, 17, and 15. The two oldest children are sons who work and study; the third child is a daughter who is married and lives with her husband; and the youngest son is in high school. 

Doña Rosa and her family live in a section of Turi Parish in Cuenca, Ecuador, where many people are farmers, ranchers, and shopkeepers. Doña Rosa's  neighborhood is very popular with tourists as it offers beautiful views of the city.  

Doña Rosa takes care of her home and also raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She also grows crops for the family and sells part of the harvest. 

Doña Rosa is taking out another loan to purchase feed for her chickens as she has a large flock. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for chickens.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Yolanda con su negocio, de fabricación de ropa infantil y venta calzado para damas, Con su anterior credikiva se benefició mucho, porque logró tener en sus manos un mayor capital para invertir, su liquidez fluyó, por eso se incrementaron sus ventas y sus utilidades y con ello los ingresos de la microempresa y de su familia. "Dios los bendiga para que sigan apoyándonos siempre" son sus palabras para con los finaciadores de Kiva. 
En la actualidad requiere atender los pedidos de su clientela,porque son superiores en el mes de Diciembre  y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a esta oportunidad, por ello está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamineto, mediante el cual comprará, tela para elaborar ropa para niñas, vestidos para damas , comprará calzado y accesorios tambien . Asi estará satisfecha su clientela mientras ella aumenta sus ganancias, para lograr mayor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Yolanda with her business making children's clothing and selling women's shoes. She was greatly benefited by her last Kiva loan, because she was able to have more capital at hand to invest. Her liquidity fluctuated, so her sales and profits increased along with the earnings of her small business and her family's income. "God bless them so they will always keep supporting us" are her words for the Kiva lenders. 

She currently needs to attend to her customers' requests, because they are higher during the month of December and her working capital is insufficient for responding to them at this time. She is therefore applying for a new loan, with which she will buy fabric to make children's clothing and women's dresses, shoes and accessories. Her customer base will thus be satisfied while she increases her earnings in order to achieve greater well being for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing for little girls, women's dresses, shoes and accessories

loans.name: Nora Doris

texts.es:
Doris vive en el distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho, con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de venta de gas domésticos, y con cuyos ingresos puede sacar adelante a su pequeños hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad.

Doris esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a la mototaxi con la cual reparte los balones de gas, de esta manera podrá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones para atender los pedidos de sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Doris lives in the San Juan de Lurigancho district.  She puts a lot of effort into her business selling gas for home use.  She's able to get her young 5 and 7 year-old children ahead with her income.

Doris is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to perform general maintenance on her motorcycle taxi, with which she distributes the gas cylinders.

This way her vehicle will be in good condition for tending to customer requests and being able to improve her income.  She'll continue striving to achieve her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jacqueline Rocio

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline de 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija que depende de sus ingresos, se dedica a prestar servicios como gerente comercial en una empresa donde ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y con muchas ganas de superarse para llegar a un mejor puesto de trabajo, su pareja la abandono hace 6 años, desde ese momento lucho y paso muchos obstáculos en el transcurso de su vida, recientemente le robaron monitores de su café internet, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de monitores, el mismo es administrado por su madre, pero ahora se encuentra cerrado, este es un ingreso económico extra que obtiene para satisfacer las necesidades económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 31, is single and has a daughter who depends on her income.  She makes a living as the business manager in a company.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person with a great desire for self-improvement so she can get a better job.

Her spouse abandoned her six years ago.  Since then she has struggled and faced many obstacles in her life.

Recently the monitors were stolen from Jacqueline's Internet café, so she's requesting a loan to buy monitors.  Her mother runs the café but currently it's closed.  This is an extra income she earns to satisfy her family's economic needs.

loans.use: to buy monitors

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 61-year-old married man with 6 children between the ages of 15 and 30. He describes himself as confident. 

He has operated a farm to grow tea for 2 years. His business is well located and he has both large and small scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as tea price fluctuations. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. 

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes to be prosperous in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to resell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 41-year-old married man with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 12. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a taxi business to transport customers. He also grows tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is well located to support his customers. He will use the 50,000 KES  to buy  tea leaves, fuel for his taxi,  and start another business. 

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes to be prosperous in the future. This is Anthony's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, fuel for his taxi, and start another business.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María, a sus 42 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente desde hace 10 años aproximadamente; vende comidas que ella misma elabora como tamales y morcilla, además presta el servicio de alimentación para fiestas y banquetes durante los fines de semana, vende ropa, productos por catálogo y artículos de decoración para el hogar, especialmente navideños. Estos oficios los aprendió de manera empírica y ahora se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos y mercancía al por mayor, con el ánimo de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año y cumplir con las solicitudes de los contactos de las casas de banquetes, esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su ardua labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor propósito es poder adquirir un local fijo, en el que pueda prestar sus servicios y generar oportunidades de empleo, esto le ayudará para mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old. She’s worked as an independent retailer for about 10 years. She sells food that she makes like tortillas and black pudding. She also caters for parties and banquets on weekends and sells clothing, catalogue items, and home décor, including Christmas decorations. She learned this work on the job, and right now it’s her main way of bringing in income to meet her family’s basic needs. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies and merchandise in bulk with the intention to take advantage of the holiday season and to fill the orders she has with banquet facilities. This will allow her to increase the income she gets from her hard work.  

María says that her big goal is to be able to have a fixed location where she can provide her services and generate employment opportunities. This will improve her business’s profitability and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Jeneba from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of nine and fifteen. Her children are attending school. 

Jeneba runs a retail business, selling assorted drinks, juice and pure water. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business eight hours per day, seven days per week.  Jeneba says that the major problem for her business is transportation.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale. The extra income from increased sales will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a general store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo2, Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2010, Mariatu established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business for ten hours per day, six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from increased sales will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Sarah from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. In 2004, Sarah established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to educate her children. She works at the business ten hours per day, six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to purchase more rice and general stock for resale. She hopes that the extra income from increased sales will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Sarah plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Saksida Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE représente le groupe SAKSIDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 19ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme vend du poisson à la braise depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville. Ses clients sont  les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02cartons de poissons frais.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à la scolarisation de son enfant. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand poissonerie.
texts.en: Ms. MADELEINE represents the group SAKSIDA. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 19. One of them is in school. She has one person to support. Ms. MADELEINE has been selling grilled fish for five years. She gets her supplies at the big market in town. Her customers are men and women. She wants to purchase 2 boxes of fresh fish. With her profits, she wants to help with her children's education. Her ambition is to open a large fish shop.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
La joven diana carolina de santa marta magdalena, estudiante de mercadeo y ventas de la institución campo alto cuenta como le ha ido en su proceso estudiantil.
Ella cuenta como su carrera la ha ayudado en su ambiente personal  y profesional.
En lo personal le ha a ayudado en saberse expresar, ser abierta a cualquier pensamiento o idea, en lo profesional le ha ayudado a ser muy creativa, ser ágil en los pensamientos, a tener fluidez verbal, saber ser una líder con sólidos conocimientos acerca del mercadeo actual. También ser altamente competitiva no pasando por encima de la ética y los valores.
También nos cuenta como le ha ido en su proceso de practicas, cuenta que esta muy agradecida con la institución al haberla puesto en una muy buena institución donde ha desarrollado sus funciones acerca de el mercadeo como lo son el tele mercadeo e información al cliente.
Le gustaría que kiva le ayudara por una sencilla razón la cual es poder culminar su estudio técnico y a si poder comenzar a laborar y empezar a tener experiencia laboral certificada.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina, from Santa Marta in Magdalena, is a young sales and marketing student at the CampoAlto institution. She talks about how being a student has gone for her.

She talks about how her course of study has helped her in her personal and professional life.

Personally, it has helped her to know how to express herself, to be open to any thought or idea. Professionally, it has helped her to be very creative, to be an agile thinker, to have verbal fluency, to know how to be a leader with solid knowledge of the current market, and also to be highly competitive without ignoring ethics and values.
