With the 30,000 KES, he wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Norma Yaneth

texts.es: Norma de 29 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos de 10 años, 12 años, 13 años y un año d edad. Norma es una mujer trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas y para comprar ladrillo para el piso ya que actualmente es de tierra. Confía que con lo que percibe de su negocio podrá cancelar el crédito.
texts.en: Norma is 29 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and four children, ages 10, 12, 12, and 1.  Norma is a hardworking woman who does everything within her reach to provide better living conditions for her son.  She wants to make improvements to her house, so she is asking for this loan through FUSAI so she can buy doors and windows and bricks for the floor; it’s currently dirt.  She is confident that she will be able to pay off her debt with the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, and bricks.

loans.name: Brenda Elidenia

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven con mucho optimismo, luchadora que en compañía de su esposo trabajan arduamente para darles a sus 3 hijos un mejor futuro, un mejor bienestar y un mejor estilo de vida. A sus 29 años de edad ella tiene un grado de estudio de secundaria completa graduándose como bachiller en administración de empresas; sus hijos los dos mayores en primaria en diferentes grados de educación en una escuela de la comunidad y el ultimo en preescolar. La fuente de ingresos para su familia en su hogar depende del café actividad que ha sido practicada por generaciones en su familia y en la familia de su esposo quienes son los únicos que se involucran en las diferentes actividades a desarrollar como la aplicación de abono, foliares, poda, recolección del grano entre otras. Su experiencia es de tres años en esta actividad siendo esta su segunda cosecha en producción.
Sus planes a futuro es dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar y enviarlos a la zona rural en donde hay más opciones para que ellos puedan elegir carreras universitarias que sean de provecho. Sus metas poder construir una plancha en el patio de su casa en donde pueda lavar y secar el café una vez cortado el grano. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el fon de comprar insumos agrícolas que ayuden a la protección y cuidado de la planta y principal mente del grano.
texts.en:
Brenda is a hardworking young lady full of optimism.  She and her husband work arduously to provide a better future, wellbeing, and quality of life for their three children.  At age 29, she has a high school education with a diploma in management.  Her children are in different grades of elementary school in the local community, but the youngest is preschool.  The family source of income is coffee, which has been practiced for generations by her husband’s family.  They are the only ones in the family who do the work such as applying fertilizer, planting, trimming, harvesting, and other things.  She has three years’ experience and this is her second harvest.

Her plans for the future are to provide her children with the opportunity to attend school and send them to the rural zone where there are more opportunities for them to select careers at the university.  Her goals are to be able to build a setup on her patio where she can wash and dry the coffee once it’s been cut.

She is asking for this loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy farming supplies that will help protect and care for her main crop.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis tiene 27 años, vive en la casa de su suegra con su esposa e  hijo de 5 años. Es mecánico de profesión pero actualmente tiene un taller de cerrajería, el cual le permite solventar los gastos de su familia. Beneficiario utilizará el crédito para invertirlo en su taller (mejoramiento del local, compra de herramientas, etc.). Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y comprarse una casita.
texts.en: José Luis, 27, lives in his mother-in-law's house with his wife and 5-year-old son. He is a mechanic by trade, but he now has a locksmith shop, which allows him to pay his family's expenses. He will use the loan to invest in his workshop: remodel the space, buy tools, and more. He dreams of raising his family's standard of living and of buying a small house.

loans.use: to remodel his workshop and buy supplies.

loans.name: Virgo Group

texts.en:
Elbera is the featured borrower of Virgo group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown Philippine and came to work in Lebanon as housekeepers. Elbera is a 48-year-old married mother of two children who works as a house keeper to provide her family with the necessary living needs.

Elbera is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her beloved children's university tuition fees, which is the main aim that made her leave her hometown and work hard to see her children become well educated persons.

Elbera is the second lady standing from the left side of the pictures; as for the other group members, Cory is the lady in red, Evelyn is the second from the right with the pink top, and Julie is on the far right.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university tuition fees

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hardworking and enterprising woman who  owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with seven children, six in school and one underage.

Mwaka prepares goat meat and soup using goat head and legs and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Jovelita

texts.en:
Jovelita has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 3 years. She is widowed and works hard to support her family. 

Jovelita has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her business. In the future, Jovelita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, noodles and spices for her business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 45 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Jovelyn has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is single. She sells hardwood charcoal. At first she bought the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand her storage area. Now she buys bags to package the charcoal, and sells to small businesses in the zone. 

She needs this loan to buy charcoal because she has an increasing number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell to an increasing number of customers

loans.name: Gilbert's Group

texts.en:
Gilbert is a member of Msamaria Group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 19 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Gilbert has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Gilbert is married and has seven children. He is 53 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Gilbert has been a farmer for 15 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Gilbert first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Gilbert joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. As an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Gilbert plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Gilbert’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest, and he has been able to feed the family.

Gilbert and the Msamaria Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Eliud's Group

texts.en:
Eliud’s group has six group leader farmers and is located in Matete District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 53 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Eliud  is pictured on the right of the Genesis Group with his hand raised.

Eliud is married and has six children. He is 52 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, the savings group, and the prayer group. Eliud has been a farmer for 26 years. Eliud is a new One Acre Fund farmer and believes he can have an even better harvest this year by working with One Acre Fund.

Eliud is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Eliud joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods and because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Eliud has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. In the future, Eliud hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school, save for the future and buy a cow.
				
Eliud  and the Genesis Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Brigid's Group

texts.en:
Brigid is a member of Chekulo Group in Webuye District. She is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 67 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Brigid has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Brigid is married and has 10 children.  he is 46 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Brigid has been a farmer for 27 years. Brigid described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Brigid first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Brigid joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Brigid plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a goat, and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Brigid’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and was able to feed the family.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Brigid and the Chekulo Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Marachi's Group

texts.en:
Lukova is a group of 4 group leader farmers in Matete District. Marachi has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 34 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Marachi, 34 years old,  is married and has 4 children. He is known as hardworking and trustworthy. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Marachi has been a farmer for 6 years. He describes his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Marachi first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Marachi joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member. Marachi plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Marachi’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and feed the family.  	

Marachi and the Lukova Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Aminata from Waterloo 2, the western, rural area in Freetown. She is married with one child. In 2007, Aminata established her fast food business. She began her business because she wants to be independent. She works at the business twelve hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient finance to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, fish, drinks and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Wullamatu

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Wullamatu from Waterloo 2, the western, rural area in Freetown. She is single with no children for now. In 2001, Wullamatu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Wullamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Wullamatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.en: Ubaydullo is very clever and hardworking. He is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with parents. He graduated school with excellent marks and entered Khujand State University. He is one of the best students in the university and tries to help other students. His friends love him very much and know that Ubaydullo is honest with them. He prefers to read classic literature in his free time. He is a very smart student. Also he likes to play football with his friends. In the future he wants to be a good specialist and to work in any organization. He must pay for his tuition because his parent’s income is not enough for it. He is asking for a loan to pay for his education. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for university education

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widowed woman with eight children, who are the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Umazi has operated a cafe business, making staples such as rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her  major challenge.

Umazi wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase stocks of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks

loans.name: Guram

texts.en: Guram is a 25-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, two children and grandparents in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. His grandparents are provided with a retirement pension. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. Guram has a newly opened fast food business and needs money to purchase stock. He received credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $2000, he will purchase stock and will offer a wide assortment of fast foods to his customers. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his fast food business

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married and has five children, all in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwaka's greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past three years, Mwaka has operated a poultry sales business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Mwaka wants to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, Salome has operated a cereal shop business, selling household consumables such as wheat, rice and beans. She cites theft and competition as her major business challenges. 

Salome is requesting a KES 10,000 loan to boost her cereals business by purchasing bags of wheat, maize and beans for sale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wheat, maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia; it is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 40 years old, single, with two children who live at home, and only the younger one attends school. The older child is 28 years old. For the past few years now she has been running a cook shop where she sells rice and soup. She started this business with help from her children's father and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because of the profits she makes. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish, meat, pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and others items for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Heisell Tatiana

texts.es: Heisell es una jovencita de 22 años de edad, tiene el respaldo de sus  padres para sus gastos universitarios entre otros, ella cursa el último año de la carrera de Lic. en contabilidad, quien también en tiempos libres se dedica a aprender a realizar reposterías, de lo que disfruta mucho hacer, pero su principal meta en la vida es culminar su carrera. Solicita el apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera profesional, y poder optar por un empleo, con sus ingresos poder apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en: Heisell is a 22 year old young woman who has her parents’ support for her university expenses and other things.  She is in her last year as an accounting student and she is also learning to make pastries in her spare time, which she really enjoys.  She is asking for a loan to pay for her professional title so she can work and support her parents with her income.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 44 años de edad trabaja como auxiliar de albañil desde hace mucho tiempo y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Alfredo es un hombre visionario quien con mucho esfuerzo junto a su familia ha logrado construir su humilde casa la cual es su principal patrimonio. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: 44-year-old Alfredo has worked as a stonemason's assistant for a long time and lives in a house he owns together with his family. Alfredo is a visionary man who, with his family and a lot of effort, has managed to build his small home, which is his primary legacy. In order to improve his living conditions, he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand and gravel to install a concrete floor in his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to install a concrete floor in his home

loans.name: Bia Law

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Bialawo from Waterloo 2, the western, rural area in Freetown. She is married with one child. She started this business to create a permanent source of income to empower herself.

Bialawo runs a retail business, she sells assorted drinks, biscuits and pure water. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week.  Bialawo says that her business is doing well because out of the profit it enables her to feed her child.

Bialawo has requested a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a general stock store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 25-year-old married father of one child; he has been working as a barber for thirteen years. Husein was only twelve years old when he started working; he had to quit school during his intermediate level to financially support his parents in their living. Today, Husein is running his own barber shop, which he established in November 2010, and his business is developing gradually.

In addition to taking care of his wife and child, Husein is taking the responsibility for providing his beloved mother a good and healthy living too. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a Renault rapid car which he will use to start an additional income business through trading with special barber needs. This will support his family's living and cover their increasing needs, in addition to letting him make necessary maintenance to his house's kitchen. He hopes that he develops and expands his business in a well managed way in the future.

loans.use: To buy a Renault rapid car which he will use to start an additional income business through trading with special barber needs

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 49 years old and has two children. He aims to improve their living status to give his family a better life. He owns and manages a small eatery beside the Public Highway. He plans to offer more kinds of recipes to the customers but he has insufficient capital. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to buy raw ingredients like fish, pork, chicken meat, vegetables and seasonings to use in his eatery. Being a hardworking father, he believes that someday, he will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like fish, pork, chicken meat, vegetables and seasonings to use in his eatery.

loans.name: Nora Isabel

texts.es:
Nora de 49 años de edad habita en un barrio ubicado al sur de la ciudad,  que combina actividades, comerciales, productivas, formales e informales con actividades deportiva y recreativas, pues allí muy cerca queda el estadio de Futbol de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ciudad que para los seguidores de este deporte,  la llaman la casa de la selección Colombia, pues congrega a mas de 40 mil espectadores de la Costa Caribe y de Colombia, cuando el seleccionado se presenta a jugar.  
Nidia es una mujer comerciante, casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 19 años, que desde hace 12 tiene emprendió su propia aventura de negocios con una gran experiencia comercial, pues desde muy niña, se dedicaba a la venta de dulces y variedades, con sus amigas y vecinas del barrio. Su negocio  consiste en la venta de ropa, calzado, cosméticos y productos de revistas, o guías especializadas, el cual ha ido creciendo gradualmente; hay temporadas en las que enfrenta el desafío de tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para ofrecer lo que su clientela necesita y está dispuesta a comprar. Esta época se refiere especialmente al final del año, cuando los trabajadores, empleados y toda la comunidad en general, se prepara para recibir las fiestas de fin de año y navideñas en familia, vestidos muy elegantes.  Como Nidia ofrece este tipo de mercancías a crédito y de contado, ajustándose a las posibilidades de su clientela, la demanda aumenta y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará de contado y en mayor volumen, ropa interior y exterior, calzado y cosméticos, para responder a las solicitudes de pedidos de su clientela actual.  Su meta es fortalecer su negocio, para responder a su sueño, en unión de su esposo, de lograr que  sus hijos sean unos profesionales exitosos. Para ello se esmera trabajando diariamente durante 6 horas consecutivas en esta actividad que quiere ver crecer rápidamente.
texts.en:
Nora is 49 years old and lives in a neighborhood located in the south part of the city where there are merchants, formal and informal manufacturing, athletes and recreational activities.  The Barranquilla soccer stadium is near there for those who follow this sport.  They call this the selection house of Colombia because there are more than 40,000 spectators from the Caribbean Coast and Colombia whenever the selection shows up to play. 

Nadia is a merchant, married, and has three children, aged between 15 and 19.  She has had her own business for 12 years and has been selling candies with her friends in the neighborhood since she was a little girl.  She now sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, magazines, and specialized guides.  Her business is growing gradually.  There are times when she has challenges, such as lack of capital to buy what her customers want over the end of year season, when the workers, employees, and all of the community prepares for the Christmas and end of years festivities and dress elegantly.

Since Nadia sells her merchandise on credit and for cash, in order to increase the chance of getting more customers.  She is asking for a Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy under and outer garments, shoes, and cosmetics in quantity, in order to meet her current customer demand.  Her goal is to strengthen her business so she can work toward her and her husband’s dream of watching her children become successful professionals.  She works hard, six hours a day.  She wants to see her business grow quickly.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine studies at University, taking her Master’s Degree in Economics. She is currently in her second year of study. Narine took a loan before and has successfully paid it back. Now, this hardworking mother of two children asks for a loan to pay her university tuition. She hopes that lenders will help her to complete her education and she finally will be able to get her diploma.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fee

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn is originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. Khorn is 44 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. She farms to earn a living and grows rice to feed and support her family members. She also supplements the family’s income by working as a laborer. Khorn has been in this business for 26 years and earns about 100,000 KHR per day and  saves about 40,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Khorn is with VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her farm and grow more rice to earn additional income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for buying a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda con seis años de experiencia en cultivar y producir café forma parte de una familia de tradición agricultora ya que la caficultura por generaciones ha sido el único medio de ingreso económico y en su familia no es la excepción. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Ella es madre soltera de una hija la cual estudia en la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad donde ella habita. Con sus 35 años de edad su grado de estudio es de primaria incompleto el cual curso hasta el tercer grado ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle. La tierra que en compañía de su familia trabaja es propia gracias al esfuerzo por muchos años de trabajo la cual está ubicada a 4 kilómetros de su casa de habitación y se traslada en compañía de su familia caminando. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto con calidad ya que la zona se especializa en ello y a pesar de las muchas familias que viven de la caficultura la competencia no es problema si no las diferentes plagas, la alza de los precios de los insumos que son utilizados para dar asistencia a los mismos y el acarreo. 
Sus sueños poder ampliar sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor variedad de producto como el caturra, el lempira, el nance etc. y poder ofrecer a los diferentes clientes e intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Como madre para su hija poder apoyarla en sus estudios y lograr que ella pueda prepararse académicamente de una mejor forma para poder tener mayores oportunidades en la vida y mejores ideas de negocio. Por lo que ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL financiamiento con el cual quiere comprar insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y así al final de esta temporada lograr obtener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Florinda has six years of experience growing and producing coffee and is part of a family tradition in agriculture. Coffee growing has been the only means of  economic income for generations and her family is no exception. Her parents taught her how to work the land at an early age. She is 35 years old and is a single mom of a daughter who attends elementary school in their neighborhood.  Florinda only completed third grade because her parents didn't have the  resources to support her.

The land that she works together with her family belongs to her, thanks to many years of hard work.  It is located 4 kilometers from her house, and she walks there accompanied by her family. Her customers are buyers who go to the region looking for the good quality product the area is known for. Despite the fact that many families earn their living from coffee growing, competition is not a problem.  Instead, they must deal with such things as insects, increases in the price of supplies, and the cost of transport. Her dreams are to increase her crop and to grow a better variety of coffee such as caturra, lempira, nance, etc. to offer to the different clients and intermediaries who come to the region. As a mother, she hopes to be able to support her daughter in her studies so that she can be better prepared academically to have more opportunities in life and have a better business sense. 

For these reasons she has asked the cooperative COMIXMUL for a loan which she will use to buy agricultural supplies to use on her coffee crops and be able to have an excellent harvest at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gladis Ondina

texts.es:
Gladis es una joven de 28 años de edad, emprendedora, luchadora, motivada por su familia y compañero de hogar el cual es apoyo incondicional en las diferentes actividades que en el campo se llevan a cabo como: la aplicación de abono, foliares, insecticidas, recolección, limpieza entre otras. Tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta la cual curso hasta el 4 grado ya que su familia es de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla. Es madre de 3 hijos los cuales están pequeños y no tienen edad para estudiar. Por más de 7 años ella se ha dedicado al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol siendo sus hermanos quienes le enseñaran a trabajar desde muy temprana edad y que hoy en día sigue ejerciendo junto a su pareja. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en vestía o caminando siendo su desafió los diferentes cambios climáticos y las plagas que de no tratar a tiempo perjudican el cultivo en su totalidad.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa, acondicionada, y amplia ya que la familia está creciendo. Para sus cultivos de café seguir ampliándolos ya que ella esta con toda la juventud para trabajar y se siente capaz de llegar a ser la mejor productora de café en la zona. Como madre de familia generar el ingreso necesario para poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que puedan prepararse académicamente y puedan tener mejores oportunidades de los que ella tuvo en su juventud.
Gladis solicita a la cooperativa COMIXMUL apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así poder asistir sus cultivos de café, logrando obtener una excelente cosecha para esta temporada y re invertir en sus cultivos de café para cumplir sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Gladis is an enterprising and tenacious 28 year old young woman.  She is motivated by her family and her life partner.  He is her unconditional support in the different field activities that they do like applying fertilizers, leaf fertilizers, and insecticides; collecting the harvest; and clearing the fields, among others.  She went to primary school until the fourth grade because her family has scarce financial resources, and they were not able to support her. 
She has three small children who are not yet school age.  

She has been growing coffee, corn, and beans for over seven years.  Her siblings taught her to work at a very early age.  Now, she continues exercising this business activity together with her life partner.  Her crops are located two kilometers from her house.  She gets there on a mule or by walking.  Her challenges are the changes in the weather and the pests that, if not treated on time, completely damage the crop. 

Her dream is to have her own house, fixed up and big enough, because the family is growing.  She will continue expanding her coffee crops.  She is young enough to work, and she feels capable of becoming the best coffee producer in the area.  As a mother, she will generate the income needed in order to be able to support her children in their education.  She will do this so that they are able to have better opportunities than she did when she was a youth.

Gladis is requesting financial support from the COMIXMUL cooperative.  She will buy agricultural supplies.  This way she will be able to take care of her coffee crops.  She will manage to get an excellent harvest this season.  She will reinvest in her coffee crops in order to fulfill her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to be able to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nguku Umoja Group

texts.en:
Nguku Moja is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West District. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Nguku Moja collectively guarantee the loan.

Daniel, in the photo with his hand raised, is the leader of the group. He is 30 years old, married and has four children. Daniel has been farming for over ten years and has been a member of this group for three years. Daniel solely depends on farming to earn a living. He is asking for a loan from KIVA to enable him to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow 1/2 acre of maize and ¼ each of millet and sorghum. The upcoming harvest will provide food for his family and he will also be able to sell the surplus to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine is 41 years old and from Lagodekhi district. She lives with her daughter and grandson. Now the family is out of a source of income. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Ekaterine’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 650 USD, Ekaterine will purchase household goods at wholesale prices and sell them in her community door-to-door. Her regular customers will be her neighbors. It is obvious that the job is hard for her, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to begin a trading business

loans.name: Summaira

texts.en:
Summaira is a 33-year-old woman who is living in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband and 3 children (2 sons, 1 daughter). Her husband is a heart patient and she always worries about his health. 

For 15 years her husband has run a metal shop, which is the only source of income for their family. Both of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

Summaira has requested a loan from Kiva partner Brac Pakistan; she will use her loan to help her husband in purchasing iron sheets and some metal material for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son.

Summaira dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. She wants to say that Brac is working very well in the field of micro finance, and she is very thankful to Brac and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to buy iron material for a metal business

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.ru: Навбахор жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1993 году. Навбахор воспитывает одного маленького ребенка. Она разведена. Ее бывший муж не помогает ей по обеспечению ребенка. Навбахор после развода вернулась в родительский дом. Она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Навбахор предоставляет свои услуги дома. Она научилась от своей матери шитью женской одежды. Навбахор хочет помочь своим родителям по улучшению домохозяйства. Они живут очень в старом доме, который нуждается в ремонте. Навбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Navbahor is a cheerful gal born in 1993 and raising a small child on her own.  She is divorced, and her former husband isn't helping provide for their child.  Following the divorce, she moved back in with her parents, where she started up her own business sewing women's clothing; a trade she learned from her mother.  Navbahor wants to help her parents improve their living conditions; they live in an old home in dire need of repairs.  To this end, she is seeking a loan of 4000 somoni to buy construction materials, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Luz Natali

texts.es:
Luz vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola, Luz labora alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que este trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño de 4 años.

Luz está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar un modulo para vivienda de material drywal, con lo cual podrá tener un lugar donde vivir con mejor calidad de vida, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Luz lives in the city of Ica and works on a farm for about ten hours each day.  This work is her own source of income and her only means of moving herself forward.  She has a young 4-year-old son.

Luz is very grateful for the Kiva investors.  Thanks to the support, she will be able to buy a drywall construction kit for her house, which will allow her to have a home where she may live an improved quality of life.  She will continue fighting in order to realize her greatest dream: to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy a drywall construction kit.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot is 42 years old. He is married and resides with six children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been making metal windows, doors, stairs and roofs for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 per day. His wife is a metal sculptor who makes an income of $4 each day. To improve his family’s livelihood, Sot is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase more metal to use in his business. This purchase will help him produce more stuff and generate more income for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more metal to use in his business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for many years. Rosalina has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, pair of gloves, wheelbarrow, and fertilizer. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rosalina will expand her business to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, garden hose, pair of gloves, wheelbarrow, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shehdeh

texts.en:
Shehdeh is a 18-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Shehdeh's father works as an employee in a local firm and he earns a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Shehdeh studies engineering and he would like to finish his study to find a job and help his family in part of the family expenses. He dreams to take a higher degree in the future.

Shehdeh took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Shehdeh will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Shehdeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a widow with six children. Some of her children are adults and some are of school age. 

Her major source of income is through buying and selling used shoes. She has been in this business for four years now. She has had a loan previously, and this new loan is to purchase additional stock for her inventory. Within her six years in this business, she has had a good return of investment, and that is why she is increasing her inventory. The income from this business helped her in financing the education of her children. She hopes that she can have her own house by continuing and improving this kind of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional shoes for re-sale.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 48 years old and a farmer from a rural village in Bakan district, Pursat province. He lives with his wife, who is also a farmer, and his five single children, while their oldest child is married and lives separately. To take care of their needs, he is involved in the cultivation of rice and sells it in the local markets. As farming is the major source of the family’s income, Sok has been doing this for more 15 years with constant support from his wife and children.

Since he doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, he is unable to help his family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason, he has requested a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to build a household latrine and buy necessary related items. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, he is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy necessary related items.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios owns and operates a plot of farm land  She plants and harvests bananas to earn a living. In more than ten years of operating the farm, Remedios has earned a good living for the family and was able to repay previous loan successfully. Her previous loans was used to improve her farm. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer to have a greener farm. She wants to have a better living in the future with a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her.  Her business has been running for three years now and it is continuously growing. Her loan also helped with the education of her children while her income is supporting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for additional processed meat and frozen food needed in her business.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Victoria dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed meat and frozen food needed for her business.

loans.name: Ludy Janeth

texts.es:
Ludy es una joven de 25 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora, dinámica y con muchos ánimos y deseos de superarse en la vida. Ella es casada y madre de 2 hijos quienes estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación, comerciante ya que se dedica a la venta de pollos, guayaba y granos básicos. Ella también es agricultora ya que a temprana edad aprendió a cultivar café, maíz y frijol en compañía de sus padres y sus hermanos por vocación familiar. Sus clientes son las pulperías, vecinos, familiares, amigos y comedores de la zona local donde es entregado el producto semanalmente en donde nada más se involucran ella, su esposo y su hermano. El terreno donde está su criadero de pollo es propio gracias a una herencia de sus padres ubicado a 10 kilómetros de la comunidad donde ella habita al cual se traslada en autobús urbano.
Como madre de familia sus metas apoyar a sus hijos en la educación, brindarles la oportunidad para que estudien a nivel universitario y puedan ser grandes profesionales en la vida. Para su negocio seguir ampliando más la producción de pollo, guayaba y café para poder cubrir la demanda insatisfecha que diariamente se le presenta y que en la actualidad no se da abasto.
Por lo que ella actualmente solicita apoyo financiero a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de concentrado para pollo inicial y final, trasportar el producto ya que su lugar de trabajo está alejado del lugar donde ella compra los insumos. De esta manera ella incrementara mediante la venta de las aves sus ingresos, reinvertirá en su criadero y fortalecerá las ventas de nuevos animales.
texts.en:
Ludy, 25, is a determined, enterprising, and dynamic young woman with a lot of spirit and desire to excel in life.  She's married and the mother of two children who are in different grades in elementary school.

Ludy's a merchant because she earns a living selling chickens, guava, and basic grains.  She's also a farmer because at a young age she learned to grow coffee, corn, and beans in the family business with her parents and siblings.  Her customers are the grocery stores, neighbors, family members, friends, and eateries in the local area where she delivers her products weekly.  Only she, her husband, and her sister are involved.  The land where she keeps her chicken coop is her own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents; it's located 10 kilometers from the community where she lives and she gets there on an urban bus.

As a mother her goals are to support her children in their studies and give them the opportunity to go to college and become great professionals in life.  Her business goals are to continue expanding her chicken, guava, and coffee production so she can cover the unmet demand she currently faces every day but can't keep up with.

This is why Ludy's currently requesting financial support from the COMIXMUL cooperative.  She's going to buy concentrated feed for young and old chickens to transport, because her workplace is far from where she buys the inputs.  This way she'll increase her income through the sale of the poultry and reinvest in her coop and strengthen sales of new animals.

loans.use: to buy and transport concentrated chicken feed

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga Marina tiene 32 años de edad, es ama de casa y caficultora casada que en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos trabajan la agricultura para poder generar ingresos para su hogar. Ella por la falta de dinero no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que desciende de una familia económicamente humilde. Su esposo la apoya en las diferentes actividades del campo ya que juntos tienen una gran experiencia en la caficultura pues por parte de ambas familias es una vocación siendo sus padres quienes les apoyaran y les enseñaran las técnicas para cultivar café. Una de las dificultades que ella identifica es la alza de los precios de los insumos que ella utiliza para asistir sus cultivos agregando a esto el acarreo de los mismos siendo este un costo difícil de minorar ya que la competencia no es un problema.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, formula cafetalera, urea, insecticida entre otros, los cuales son necesarios para la protección y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café de las diferentes plagas que conlleven al deterioro de la planta en general.
Sus planes a futuro son los de seguir incrementando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos y su familia mejorando la calidad de vida y apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios dando la oportunidad de que puedan superarse y estudiar universitaria mente.
texts.en:
Olga Marina is 32 years old, married, and is a housewife and coffee grower. Along with her husband and children she works in agriculture, enabling them to generate income for their household. Because of lack of money she didn't have the chance to go to school, as she comes from a family of modest means. 

Her husband helps her in the various farm activities, as together they have a great deal of experience in growing coffee. This because it is a livelihood for both of their families, and their parents will help them and teach them the techniques for growing coffee.

One of the difficulties she identifies is the rise in the prices of supplies that she uses to maintain their crops, adding to this the cost of transporting them, which is difficult to reduce. Competition is not a problem.

So today she is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, coffee-formulated fertilizer, urea, insecticide, and other items. These are necessary to protect and maintain their coffee plantation from the various pests that bring with them plant deterioration.  

Her plans for the future are to continue expanding her coffee plantings by buying more land; building up the legacy for her children and family, improving their quality of life, helping her children with their education and giving them the opportunity to excel and attend university.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for maintaining her coffee plantation.

loans.name: William Alexis

texts.es: William de 25 años de edad es soltero y  reside en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace mucho tiempo. Él se trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad en la cual tiene 4 años de prestar sus servicios. William desea terminar de construir un cuarto dormitorio el cual no ha logrado terminar por falta de recursos económicos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento y hierro.
texts.en:
William is twenty-five years old.  He is single and has lived in his own house alongside his relatives for a long time.  He works as an employee at a local business close to his town; he has worked there for four years.  

William hopes to finish building a bedroom, which he has been unable to complete due to a lack of economic resources.  For these reasons, William has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, sand, cement, and iron bars.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, and iron bars to finish constructing a bedroom.

loans.name: Mario Ericson

texts.es:
Mario agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él se alegro porque está viendo crecer su negocio por la ayuda de estos créditos, él continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores en la comunidad de Pilco - Grande, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes y gallinas para hacerlos crecer y para luego venderlos en esta época navideña. 
(La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mario is grateful to the Kiva lenders for his previous loan and is pleased with the support he was given. He is happy because he was able to grow his business with the help of these loans. He continues to engage in farming, cattle breeding, and raising small animals in the community of Pilco - Grande.

Mario is taking this opportunity to request another loan so that he can buy more small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens, that he can raise and later sell during the Christmas season.

The community of Pilco - Grande is located in the District of Huayllabamba, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ahro

texts.ru: Ахро жизнерадостный и честный человек из Севера Таджикистана. Он родился в 1975 году. Ахро с детства помогал родителям по животноводству. Он трудился упорно и именно его труд стал в его жизни гарантом удачи. Ахро сегодня имеет свой собственный бизнес скотоводством. Он имеет хорошую возможность развевать свой бизнес, так как он живет в сельской местности. Ахро хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ahro was born in 1975 and is a cheerful, honest man from northern Tajikistan. He helped his parents with raising livestock when he was a child. He has always worked hard, and his hard work has brought him good luck. Ahro now has his own cattle business and has good opportunity for growth because he lives in a rural area. Ahro wants to increase his working capital and has asked for a loan of $2000 USD to purchase cattle. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Marley Yurani

texts.es:
Ella es marley, en estos momentos esta estudiando contabilidad, escogió esta carrera porque ve que tiene una gran salida en el futuro porque es una carrera que es muy importante, la ilusión es que al terminar el técnico como auxiliar contable y luego seguir la carrera en una universidad para que cuando acabe pueda desempeñarse como contadora. Le gustaría también tener su propia empresa y escalar cada vez mas, también le gustaría en un futuro tener un buen empleo, para a si ayudar a la familia en todos los gastos que se les presente, puesto que los papas pagan el estudio de ella y otros dos hermanos, le gustaría que a si como ellos la han ayudado también colaborar en todo aquello que necesiten y pagarse ella misma la carrera.
Actualmente también se encuentra estudiando en grado once, lo que permite este técnico es que cuando ella se gradué tenga varias posibilidades de entrar a un buen trabajo, para que ella tenga una buena entrada de dinero, seguir pagando la carrera profesional y también le ayudara porque como contadora tiene buena salida para cualquier tipo de trabajo.
Escogió esta carrera, le pareció muy llamativa, por los beneficios que se obtienen y para salir mejor preparado del colegio y a si cuando ingrese a la universidad sera un poco menos difícil de entender las cosas, porque ella dice que sabiendo muchas cosas que aprendió en el instituto sera mas fácil entender todo y a si poder graduarse y desempeñar su carrera. 
En el segundo al que ingresa, espero le vaya muy bien para graduarse y luchar por lo que desea.
Le gustaría obtener ese beneficio de kiva ya que es muy necesario y también le ayuda bastante a los papas, puesto que el papa trabaja independiente y el le brinda el estudio al hermano, ya que el también inicia su carrera como contador publico en la universidad, ya que el no tiene ingresos el papa se lo brinda, y la hermana también estudia en el colegio, y también el papa paga todos los gastos que ella necesite y el estudio, mi mama es ama de casa, lo cual no gana nada, y por eso quiere desempeñar la carrera para poder brindarle a su familia la ayuda lo mas pronto posible. 

Gracias
texts.en:
This is Marley. She is currently studying accounting. She chose this career because she sees a great beginning for her future because it is a career of great importance. Her dream is to finish her training to be an accounting assistant and then to pursue a path in college so that she can become an accountant when she finishes. She also would like to have her own business and continue scaling it up. She'd also like in the future to have a good job so that she can help her family with all of their expenses since her parents have paid for her education as well as the education of her two siblings. She would like to help her parents as they have helped her and pay for her degree herself. 

Marley is also currently studying in the eleventh grade. She is studying this specialty so that she can have several chances for getting a good job when she graduates so that she can continue paying for training. That will be helpful for her because she could have a good start at any job as an accountant.

She chose this degree because it seemed very appealing for the benefits she could obtain by getting better prepared in school. When she enters college, it will be less difficult for her to understand things. She says that knowing the many things she learns in school will make it easier to understand everything to graduate and fulfill her career goals. Also, when she enters college, she hopes it will go well so she can graduate and work for what she wants. 

She would like to receive this Kiva loan because it is very necessary and also helps her parents since her father works independently and provides for her brother's studies. Her brother also began his career as a public accountant in college. His father does not have much income and Marley's sister is also studying in high school paid for by her father. Her mother is a homemaker and does not earn an income and, for this reason, Marley wants to carry out her work in this career as soon as possible to be able to help her family.

Thank you.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition to study accounting.

loans.name: Lis

texts.en:
Lis is 22 years old. She is single and resides with her mother in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her mother is a rice farmer who makes an income of $1 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Lis is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) for her brother to run public transportation service. This purchase will help him generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and build a new house, if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Maryam is an 18-year-old single lady from a small village near Deir Al-Balah city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Maryam's brother works in the public sector and earns a low income. Maryam studies Islamic origins, and she would like to finish her studies and take the BA degree to find a job and help with part of the family's expenses.

Maryam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Maryam will be able to do her homework and write her reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 19-year-old single lady from Dier Al-Balah city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Samia's father works in the public sector and earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Samia studies office automation and secretarial. She would like to finish her studies and find a job to help with part of her family's expenses. Samia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Samia will be able to do her homework and write her reports easily. 

Samia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Mern

texts.en:
Mern is 41 years of age, and a widowed mother of four children. Three of them are employed in various occupations and the other one is attending school. Mern lives with her children in her own settlement located in a rural village of Siem Reap province. Mern is a farmer and has been raising rice crops for nearly 17 years. 

At this time, Mern is asking for a loan of USD 450 to buy a used motorcycle for her household. In the previous time, her family members were experiencing difficulties in fulfilling their transport needs and her employed children have to pay for motor taxi service every day for commuting to their workplaces without having a household motorcycle. This purchase will allow them to reduce unnecessary expenses and save more for the family. Mern will highly appreciate the lenders support, and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her household.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 36 years of age, is married, and she and her husband are blessed with two children. 

She has owned and managed a retail store business in their village for almost fifteen years, and with this she is earning a net income of PHP 200 per day. Her profits are usually spent on purchasing hog feed for her hogs to generate additional income. 

Due to insufficient funds she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, noodles, rice, candies, and beverages. She is hoping that her requested loan will be immediately granted so that she can improve her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, detergent soap, noodles, rice, candies, and beverages.

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Dara is a hardworking man who is 41 years of age. He is married and has been blessed with two children who live with him, and are attending local primary school. Dara works for the government as a small officer, and earns a decent income to raise his family. His wife, who carries out the duties at home to assure the state of well-being of the family, also helps him earn income by farming seasonal rice crops. 

Dara and his wife aim to enlarge their farming areas and increase their production so that they can provide their children with their basic necessities. That’s why Dara is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,100,000 to buy a plot of land for farming purpose. With the loan support, he hopes that he will be able to make his business more productive and improve the income for the household.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for farming purposes.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 61 years old. She is married and has ten children. With one child in school, Flordeliz works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, etc., to sell.  Flordeliz has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Flordeliz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, like shampoo, soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Betty Elena

texts.es: Betty  de 56 años de edad  tiene un pequeño almacén de variedades en su domicilio, ubicado al sur de la ciudad. Su experiencia comercial data de hace 20 años, cuando por necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos familiares, mediante su independencia económica, decidió emprender su propia aventura emprendedora, en la que hasta hoy continua trabajando y quiere hacer crecer. Ella vende de contado en un horario laboral desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, comprando en almacenes de mayoristas que le ofrecen mejores opciones. Sus clientes son fijos y ocasionales y cuenta con muchos referidos, que compran directa mete en su local ubicado en su propio domicilio. En temporadas como navidad y año nuevo, su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente dinero para invertir, e incrementar sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades, Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en mercancías variadas de las que Mas rotan en su variedad, como juguetes, ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Con su credikiva, planea obtener éxito, porque hace la inversión en la temporada mas comercial del año, donde hay un buen flujo de efectivo circulante.
texts.en:
Betty is 56 years old and has a small variety store in her home, located in the south part of town.  She has 20 years’ experience in this business.  She began her entrepreneurial venture out of a need to increase the family income.  It continues and she wants to grow it.

She works from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm, buying from large suppliers who offer her better deals.  She has steady and occasional customers and she has many referrals who buy directly from her.  During seasons such as Christmas and new year, her main challenge is having enough money to invest and increase her sales.  She is asking for a her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy merchandise such as toys, clothing, shoes, and  cosmetics.  She plans to be successful through her Kiva loan, because she is making this investment during the busiest time of the year, where there is a good amount of money in circulation.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia: 
José tiene 53 años, está casado desde hace 28 años y tiene 4 hijos.  Él tiene una herrería donde fabrica puertas, zaguanes y ventanas desde hace 15 años. 
Necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como lámina, ángulos, caramelo, cuadrado y tubo, ya que tiene varios pedidos en puerta que necesita atender y entregar puntualmente.  
Entre sus logros se encuentra haber logrado mantener su negocio durante estos 15 años y haber comprado su automóvil; pero principalmente, ser el sustento de su familia y haberles dado educación a sus hijos.  Su reto es continuar atendiendo a sus clientes con la puntualidad que lo ha caracterizado y seguir apoyando a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José's a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

José, 53, has been married for 28 years and has four children.  He has a metal shop where he has made doors and windows for 15 years.

He needs the loan to buy supplies such as metal sheeting, paint, braces, and tubing.  He has several requests for doors that he needs to make and deliver punctually.

One of José's achievements is having supported his business these 15 years and having bought a car.  His main achievement, though, is supporting his family and giving his children an education.  His challenge is to continue serving his customers with his characteristic punctuality and supporting his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 5 hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace un años estableció su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, harina, sal, pan, huevos, churros, refrescos, lácteos, productos enlatados y de aseo. anteriormente trabajo en un maquila y luego de quedar sin empleo decidió poner este negocio. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería, con productos como granos básicos, harina, manteca, lácteos, refrescos, churros y otros que necesite, para poder aumentar las ventas. Tiene como meta ampliar mas  el negocio para surtirlo y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta is 33 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with her husband with whom she has five children.  They live in the village of Choloma, Cortes. A few years ago she established her own business, a grocery store, where she sells staple grains, sugar, flour, salt, bread, eggs, chips, soft drinks, dairy products, canned goods, and toiletries.  She previously worked in a factory but when she was laid off she decided to start this business.

She has asked for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to stock her shop with such items as staple grains, flour, lard, dairy products, soft drinks, chips, and other things she needs to increase her sales.  Her goal is to expand her business, restock it and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her business with products such as staple grains, flour, lard, dairy products, soft drinks, chips, etc.

loans.name: Gosebe Group

texts.en:
Gosebe is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge of improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Gosebe collectively guarantee the loan.

The picture shows Francis raising his hand. He has been a farmer for many years but has been a member of this group for four years. He is 53 years old, married with nine children. His children still attend school. Having a large family, he is constrained financially. Francis is therefore requesting a loan from KIVA to enable him to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer that will allow him to practice better farming methods. He will plant maize on a half acre and sorghum and millet on a quarter acre each. Francis hopes to realize an increase in farm production. He will be able to easily feed his family and sell the surplus. The profit he gets in his harvest will be invested in his children’s education through fee payment.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Lydia Emperatriz

texts.es: Lydia de 65 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo y sus nietos. Lydia se gana la vida mediante la elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son muy demandadas por sus vecinos. Ella habita en condiciones muy sencillas y con mucho esfuerzo va mejorando sus condiciones habiatacionales. Desea construir un cerco perimetral para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta. Con el monto solicitado comprará postes de cemento y rollos de alambre de púa. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así comenzar lo antes posible con la construcción del cerco.
texts.en:
Lydia is sixty-five years old.  She lives in her own home together with her life partner, their son, and their grandchildren.  Lydia gets ahead in life by making and selling tortillas.  These goods are always in high demand in her neighborhood.  She lives in very humble conditions and has been improving her home through a lot of effort and determination.

She hopes to construct a perimeter wall.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She does not have capital to do this herself.

With the requested amount, she will buy cement wall posts and barbed wire.  She hopes to have this support and to thereby begin constructing the wall as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement fence posts and barbed wire in order to build a perimeter fence.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 20-year-old, single man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Hisham's mother works in the public sector and earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Hisham studies Nursing. He would like to finish his study, to find a job and help his family with part of the family's expenses.
